They provide functionalities to ensure that the requirements for data security, integrity, quality, privacy are met and they comply to enterprise guidelines and standards.

name: DSM
shortDescription: Data Store Management
longDescription: Data Store Management application (s) provides the functionalities to manage the data stores including lifecycle, structure, meta models and auditing to ensure that the Data Stores are available for use by Data Management applications.

name: DSAA
shortDescription: Data Storage and Archival
longDescription: Data Storage and Archival application provides functionalities to manage the lifecycle of data. Including read, creation, updating, deletion and data archival as per compliance policies. This includes log information for audit and reporting purposes to ensure that the stored data follows the data compliance guidelines.

name: DDM
shortDescription: Data Distribution Management
longDescription: Data distribution management application provides functionalities to control the access to the data on request or according to configuration or subscription. The distribution of data is done in accordance to Compliance and Policies.

name: DCAPM
shortDescription: Data Compliance and Policy Management
longDescription: Data Compliance and Policy management application provides functionalities to define and manage the data compliance policies and rules e.g. the data privacy, data security and policies for trust management etc. It makes the policies and rules available for use by other Data Management applications.

name: DTAF
shortDescription: Data Transformation and Formatting
longDescription: Data Transformation and Formatting application works as a mediation layer to enable Data Management applications to provide seamless interface to make the data ready for storage and make it available for consumption as per application specific format. It also provides functionalities to secure data for e.g. (encryption of credit/debit card details) as defined by data compliance guidelines.

name: EAI
shortDescription: Enterprise Application Integration
longDescription:
Enterprise Application Integration (EAI) is a business computing term for the plans, methods, and tools aimed at modernizing, consolidating, and coordinating the applications in an enterprise. EAI technology allows this integration to be done using techniques that leverage the architecture. Using these concepts, applications send or receive events / messages to or from other components or send or receive notifications. Such architecture provides greater degrees of freedom. For example, components can be replaced by new ones more easily as they have the same interface. It is also easier to plug-in a new component that will use the services already available. EAI includes:
? transport of data between applications
? data format translations
? implementation, at EAI level, of enhanced enterprise level objects
The following are two example solutions that can be found in the EAI sub-domain:
?         Managed File Transfer, referring to software for moving data, overcoming the limitations found in conventional FTP (e.g. support to multiple protocols, automation, security, auditability, monitoring, etc.).   
?         Cache and Distributed Caching, which goals are to provide performance and scalability to applications.
In the following sections, we start with a description of the analysis methodology and guidelines that are used in this section for the EA Integration of the focused applications. Use of this analysis methodology should reduce making inappropriate decisions based on expected capabilities associated with such architectures.
It must also be noted that Enterprise Integration is generally implemented in a number of successive phases. This is particularly true when few existing applications are already efficiently integrated together. It is recommended that the first phases usually consist in the integration of new features and new applications and that in further phases it can be envisaged to enhance the integration of the existing applications.

name: BPM&W
shortDescription: Business Process Management & Workflow
longDescription:
Business Process Management (BPM) is the evolution of earlier concepts called workflow management (also known as Process Flow Management). As operators understand the need to introduce much greater flexibility and day-day change into their business processes, BPM and workflow management techniques, pioneered in manufacturing industry, are becoming more and more visible in the communications industry. 
Business flexibility is crucial for an operator as well as high levels of automation of its processes, not just of basic process flows but of complex and exception handling areas. One of the cardinal principles of Frameworx is to allow this by abstraction of business processes from application logic. The emergence of N-tier computing and component-oriented environments (such as COM and J2EE) allow for this principle in the same manner that the emergence of SQL and the two-tier client/server architecture enabled the abstraction of data management from application code. By separating business process management as an independent function, applications can be designed around existing processes, and thus to take advantage of shared business logic rather than reinventing and recoding it for each application.There are considerable benefits to an operator in adopting this type of approach and would include:Reduced costsStaff savingsCash flow improvementBetter customer perceptionFaster and more flexible response to implement new processes or amend existing ones to accommodate new products / servicesTo understand how BPM fits with an operator and its infrastructure, it is helpful to examine the individual components of BPM. While commercial implementations vary in their specific definitions and software composition, most fit within the basic framework described below. Note that although some systems offer the ability to automate activities and define business rules, those that lack the fundamental components below cannot realistically be used as a BPM system.A BPM system is defined by the components of:Execution EngineProcess Designer,Process DefinitionsActivity MonitorUser interface which may be a combination of a Windows client application, HTML based Work Portal, or an exposed API or Web serviceThe majority of BPM systems on the market today are component-oriented and allow each of the individual pieces listed above to be deployed independently on individual servers. Individual business processes are defined by the process owner in a Process Definition, (increasingly expressed in a standard language such as UML or some variation of XML). Each Process Definition may be composed of both manual activities and automated activities. Once defined and validated within the Process Designer, processes are instantiated by an Execution Engine. The Activity Monitor provides access to status and performance metrics on the execution of processes. End-to-end process ?orchestration?It is unlikely that the implementation of a Frameworx based ?lean? migration program will be a ?big bang? type of approach implementing all new systems. Therefore, the Enterprise Integration Framework will need to integrate end-to-end processes across various ?islands of automation? ranging from existing legacy systems to new commercial-off-the-shelf technology. This approach is sometimes called ?orchestration? in process. An orchestration-based approach offers the ability to manage processes of greater complexity, (such as complex business service provisioning etc.) with far more efficiency than is otherwise possible with alternative approaches. The key to this is a modular approach to managing business rules, relationships, and activities.Within a simple workflow automation paradigm, processes are defined ?end-to-end? with all possible paths (or more commonly a single path) pre-determined. Thus ?Step 5? always follows ?Step 4? and precedes ?Step 6? even if different instances of an otherwise standard process may require a different sequence.Orchestration allows for the sequencing of steps to be determined during the ?run-time? instance of a process, with paths determined by evolving context resulting from each new step. Thus the potential number of paths and outcomes may otherwise be too complex to define in terms of pre-determined ?If-Then-Else? rules, but may be easily resolved through human interaction and decision-making. This highlights the key architectural difference between automation and orchestration. Given the inherent complexity and constant changes within an operator?s business environment, effectively managing processes requires the agility to shift with changes in context, rather than always being bound to the same scripted flow. This requires the unique ability to define processes as a set of atomic, goal-based activities with the enforcement of basic parameters (e.g., time limits, data variables), while separating the execution logic activities from the higher-level process definition. Process orchestration is not limited to invoking software, but rather represents a shift from task-based to goal-oriented process definition. Web services and other forms of software automation are utilized through process orchestration, yet not to the exclusion of manual, human-driven activities.

Period end adjustments, that concern deferred revenue and accrued assets, become a legal obligation.
For pre-paid, the paid amounts (top-ups) are initially considered as deferred revenue; deferred revenue is turned into revenue through the actual usage (credit consumption).
After the use-by date, the remaining credit is written off as a profit.

name: AGL
shortDescription: API Gateway
longDescription: Application Programming Interface Gateway Logging function log task enables the logging of any request or response at any time during the processing of a strategy. The function should be able to execute synchronously or asynchronously, and target a designated file system path, database server, HTTP URL, or email address. If configurable to run only for a specific request or response message of a specific user (or user role) the task can be targeted to a specific operation of a specific service enabler. These granularities together with the possibility to deliver the log information in different channels offer great flexibility for both operation and debug scenarios. Including CDR creation of Call Detail Record for calculating API usage fee.

API Gateway

This capability lowers dramatically the number of malformed messages that are presented to a given service enabler, and by doing so contributes to maximize the performance and scalability of that service enabler.

name: AGWPDT
longName: API Gateway Web protocol data transforming
shortDescription: API Gateway
longDescription:
Application Programming Interface Gateway Mediation function with support for Data Format, Data Model transformations and Protocol Bridging between most or all common Web standards including:
> Parameter transform: modifications of parameter names and/or parameter values
> Method transform: modifications of the method specified in API request (e.g., POST to DELETE)
> Error information transform: modifications of error information in the body part of API response
> Status code transform: modifications of status code in the API response 
> Information masking: filtering some information in the API response based on query parameters in API request or based on API provider?s policy
> Abstraction: conceptually transformations of the meanings of parameters or decrease of the number of request parameters

name: BDC
shortDescription: Adjustments
longDescription:
Bill dispute consists of handling the customer inquiries received through customer service, self care or any other channel about their bills that have not been solved by simple actions (e.g walk customer through their invoice or grant the request when disputed amount is inferior to a threshold).

?The case is closed.
When the dispute is granted, the granted amount must be taken off the debt, through a debit adjustment, i.e a negative charge or billable item. Depending on the available IT capabilities or business rules in force, this may be billed either as part of the following periodic invoice, or as a specific invoicing process and related accounting document (in this case a credit note).
The reason for the adjustment must be recorded, for example adjustment may be a gesture of goodwill from the company, or a correction for a proven billing error. Depending on local law and regulation, the process and applicable rules may be different.
In addition, if the investigation showed an error in product and services data (e.g wrong service affected to a contract), the settlement will also include an update request to the installed offer and products repository and services repository .

name: BDI
shortDescription: Adjustments
longDescription:
Bill dispute consists of handling the customer inquiries received through customer service, self care or any other channel about their bills that have not been solved by simple actions (e.g walk customer through their invoice or grant the request when disputed amount is inferior to a threshold).
?The initial customer contact and the disputed amount are recorded.

name: BDI
shortDescription: Adjustments
longDescription:
Bill dispute consists of handling the customer inquiries received through customer service, self care or any other channel about their bills that have not been solved by simple actions (e.g walk customer through their invoice or grant the request when disputed amount is inferior to a threshold).

?The case is investigated using billing data (invoice images, billed items, usage history) A/R data (e.g search of unmatched payment) and others (e.g installed products, network databases?).

name: BDN
shortDescription: Adjustments
longDescription:
Bill dispute consists of handling the customer inquiries received through customer service, self care or any other channel about their bills that have not been solved by simple actions (e.g walk customer through their invoice or grant the request when disputed amount is inferior to a threshold).

?The dispute settlement results in customer notification of the results, dispute granted (for the whole disputed amount or part of it) or customer request denied.

name: CEV

Manage multi-versions of the same entity is a very important aspect in a catalog. 
The complexity starts with the ability to manage multiple versions for single entities, however in real life it is required to support much more complex scenarios where entities relate to other entities that have a different lifecycle and a different versions map, however the validity and maintenance of the versions needs to be maintained

name: CIH

Catalog data requires easy storage and retrieval of information. Historical changes should be stored and easily retrieved, including changes done on the entity level or changes done by different users.

name: CIR

Human errors during product and service configuration cause major problems in testing and production phases, and automatic mechanisms that can eliminate such errors in advance are mandatory.

name: CILA

For example, how product definition translate corresponds to different services provisioning rules, and so on

name: CMFFR

name: CMR

name: CRC

name: CVM

Generating different views for users that manage different data layers. As a master catalog can support multiple lines of business and multiple layers, it should be dynamic enough to provide different display options for the different cases
For example, a network implementer may require a visual graph that will show relations between services in a graphical manner, while a product manager will require a dedicated view that displays only the product offerings that are under his domain of responsibility. Creating differnet custom views for different roles is a mandatory requirement in such a catalog.

Collection Treatment Management - Defines and initiates the collection treatment activities according to the appropriate collection policy. A collection treatment can belong to one of the following categories:  
o Issue notice (e.g. Collection Letter, e-mail or SMS) 
o CSR assignment ? Assign a CSR or a CSR group to manually handle the collection. 
o Issue Restrict/Restore/Disconnects request - Includes anything from restricting to suspensions, as well as the restoration when payment is received. 
o OCA Referrals - Passing the collection process on to an Outside Collection Agency.

Customer's Account Adjustment adjust customer's account balance based on the result of a detailed assessment or dispute. Possible 
adjustments may include tax adjustments, account/invoice/charge level adjustment, good will adjustment as well as refund or credits.
All adjustments are made based on schedule of authorization polices. The customer service representative (CSR) can also consider the history 
and nature of previous dispute & adjustment requests made by the customer.

Customer and Product Data Collection

The Customer Behaviour Tracking function concerns the necessary functionality to monitor the Customer Behaviour during its relationships with Orange, public communications and its products uses.
It includes:

name: CBT

Customer risk analysis is based on information collected from all processes and that consistent risk assessment is used across the Enterprise 
It includes also detection of the outstanding payment risks, for a new customer or during a new order for example, with:
? Definition of the class "bad debtors?,
? Analysis of the profiles of bad debtor behaviours.

This action can be taken either proactively by reaching out to the customer, or reactively when the customer contacts the Service Provider.

name: COCM

longDescription: Order Change Management ? Amend pending order resulted from customer change requests or provisioning system limitation, revalidate the order. Including

name: COC
shortDescription: Customer Order Establishment
longDescription: The Customer Order Completion function enables completion and finalization the Customer Order with collection of Customer Data or installed base data according to the Catalog. It allows to complete the configuration element not necessary for the quotation. The complements could also concern links with actors, dates, adress, billing account.

name: CODCFED
longName: Customer Order data calculation from existing data
shortDescription: Customer Order Enrichment
longDescription: Application function to calculate missing order data values on-the-fly from existing data and ordering rules.

name: CODEFES
longName: Customer Order data enrichment from external systems
shortDescription: Customer Order Enrichment
longDescription: Application function to acquire missing order data from external 3rd party systems (like country's common address or credit check system).

name: CODEFIS
longName: Customer Order data enrichment from internal systems
shortDescription: Customer Order Enrichment
longDescription: Application function to acquire missing order data from surrounding systems (often values taken from catalogs and inventories, billing, fraud, etc.)

name: CODAD
shortDescription: Customer Operational Decisioning
longDescription:
Customer Order Decomposition and Distribution function decomposes each relevant Product Order Item of the Customer Order, into Service Orders (CFS level) and distributes the Service Order requests to appropriate systems. For example : Service Order Management (SOM), potential 3rd parties, ...
This decomposition relies on :
- the articulation between Products and CFS described in the Catalogue Repository
- the articulation between Product Operations and CFS Operations described in the Catalogue Repository
- existing installed CFS
- the potential rules of choice if several CFS can fit in with the product.

name: COE
shortDescription: Customer Order Establishment
longDescription:
The Customer Order Commercial Eligibility  function validates that the Offer & products specified on the Customer Order, are available and feasible from a commercial and functional point of view.
It includes: 
? Commercial Eligibility with commercial compatibility with the already customer installed Offers 
? Functional Eligibility with functional  compatibility with the already customer installed Products. 
? Customer Credit Eligibility check, considering the payment history and the credit scores for a Customer, only the predictive credit score for a ProspectiveCustomer. ?
The technical feasibility is covered by th Service Availability function.

name: COID
shortDescription: Customer Order Item Decomposition
longDescription: Customer Order Item Decomposition prepares the customer order structure for breakdown into customer order items.

name: COOPC
shortDescription: Customer Order Orchestration Plan Creation
longDescription: Customer Order Orchestration Plan Creation makes an orchestration plan out of the set of customer order work items.

name: COO
shortDescription: Customer Order Orchestration
longDescription:
The Customer Order Orchestration function provides workflow and orchestration capabilities at the Product Order Item level for a dedicated Customer Order. 
Orchestration can take into account :
- constraints between Product Order Items inside the Customer Order, or successive Customer Orders including modification or cancellation (in-flight changes)
- any type of business rules based on information even external to the Customer Order. For example : high level of priority for VIP customers
-  Triggering of exception process or delivery planning update, depending on Customer Order or Service Order events.

name: CORC
shortDescription: Customer Order Rules Management
longDescription: Customer Order Rules Configuration function. In addition to Product Catalog rules (like cross/up sell rules, compatibility rules, eligibility rules, address/service availability rules, etc.) some specific types of rules must be available for all decision-based actions on customer order. These rules could be: customer fraud check, decomposition rules, priority rules, order duplication prevention rules, complex rules involving multi-system checks, etc.

name: CORSAP
longName: Customer Order Rules search and presentation
shortDescription: Customer Order Rules Management
longDescription: Customer Order Rules Search and Presentation function makes the Customer Order Rules available to customer order related applications.

name: COSAP
shortDescription: Customer Order Acceptance
longDescription: The Customer Order Search and Presentation function makes the customer orders available to other applications.

name: COS
shortDescription: Customer Order Acceptance
longDescription: The Customer Order Storage function stores the valid and complete customer orders into an appropriate data storage.

name: COT&M
shortDescription: Customer Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Customer Order Tracking & Management provides the functionality necessary to track and manage the distributed requests decomposed by Customer Order Distribution. This capability needs to be provided in both an ability to query in real time as well as a publish/subscribe mechanism to enable the use of the information wherever required.

name: COV
shortDescription:
Customer Order Establishment
Customer Order Validation
longDescription: Customer Order Validation Function ensures that the qualified order is valid in any moment of order lifecycle, usually as data become available. Validation ensures early fallout which is less costly than encountering errors in later stages of order handling.

name: COWID
shortDescription: Customer Order Work Item Decomposition
longDescription: Customer Order Work Item Decomposition decomposes customer order items into a set of customer order work items.

name: CPM

longDescription: Managing Customer Preferences - including customer proprietary information preferences (CPNI), email versus US Mail, how to be contacted (based on type of communication), web look and feel, do not solicit me. Personalization allows delivery of services that more closely match the customer's need.

name: CPD
shortDescription: Customer Problem Diagnostics
longDescription:
Determine the source (root cause) of the problem 
? Utilize service performance and service problem management functions 
? Use Diagnostics /Testing tools to determine the actual cause 
? Use a detailed physical, logical and service inventory to create a up-to-date detailed customer connectivity/topology view. 
? Receive service quality of service violation data from Service Quality Management  
? Correlate various events associated with customer contact to determine the source 
? Update the case with a ?Cause Code?

name: CP&SSC
shortDescription: Offering Availability
longDescription: Checks what the customer presently has as part of what can be further provided to the customer including bundling, product eligibility, etc.

name: CPI
shortDescription: Customer Profile Management
longDescription: Providing Customer Profile Information to any process that needs access to it

name: CPE
shortDescription: Customer Profiling
longDescription: Expose customer profiles and profiling insights and conclusions for recommendation in care treatment, x/up sell, retention, etc.

name: CPOA
shortDescription: Customer Profiling
longDescription: Profiling customer based on implicit and explicit actions, transactions (ex., deriving actual channel preference from a customer whose implicit preference is SMS, not email)

name: CRHAGM
longName: Customer Relationship, Hierarchy and Group Management
shortDescription: Customer Hierarchy & Group Management
longDescription:
The Customer Hierarchy and Group Management component stores the customer hierarchy and/or groups such as company, relationships and household structures.

Manages complex customer relationships such as an individual who performs multiple roles, or hierarchies such as complex Corporate structures. This function should be able to deal with several levels of complexity from single service accounts to multinational corporations. Hierarchies are defined by an account type and its relationships with parent and child accounts.

name: CSAP

longDescription: Translating performance and commitment data received into a form suitable for SLA analysis.

name: CSICV
shortDescription: Customer SLA Issue Reception
longDescription: Customer SLA Issue Reception function to validate an established customer with service level agreement.

name: CSIIC

longDescription: Customer SLA Collection collects additional customer SLA related information from established sources, including service quality management, service performance management, service problem management, third parties, and customers, related to a SLA issue.

name: CSIR
shortDescription: Customer SLA Issue Reception
longDescription:
SLA issue reception of the problem from: 
o Customers or customer systems 
o Internal systems (SQM, Service Problem Management, Service Performance Management, and Customer Problem Management as well as billing or fulfillment systems)

name: CSIS/EV
longName: Customer SLA Issue Service / Entitlement Validation
shortDescription: Customer SLA Issue Reception
longDescription: Customer SLA Issue Reception function to validate the service entitlement tothe service level agreement.

name: CSM
shortDescription: Customer SLA Analysis
longDescription: Monitoring ?pending? SLA violations before they occur (?Jeopardy?) by measuring current performance/commitment activity compared to SLA thresholds

name: CSSTCA
longName: Customer SLA service to contract analysis
shortDescription: Customer SLA Analysis
longDescription: Analysing the level of service received by the customer and comparing it to the contractual obligations.  This can include analysis of historical SLA information as well.

name: CSVQ
shortDescription: Customer SLA Violation Management
longDescription: Customer SLA Violation Management function to quantify the violation in  terms of an adjustments or actions per the contract. (Per the SLA contract, )

name: CSVRI
shortDescription: Customer SLA Violation Management
longDescription: Customer SLA Violation Management function to provide the necessary functionality to pass  adjustment or action on to billing or appropriate systems for remedy

name: CSR
shortDescription: Customer Subscription Management
longDescription: Customer Subscription repository provides the functionality necessary to store and make available the products and services presently being used by the customer.

name: CVPP
shortDescription: Customer Profiling
longDescription: The Customer Value Profiling function comprises predictive Scoring of the new customer behaviour: using a predictive model based on the histories of customers having the similar profile, determine the expected evolution of the customer value and his lifetime. Customer scoring is performed when customers sign up a contract, then enriched and updated by events occurring during the customer lifecycle (e.g revenue generated, usage patterns, payment behaviour?). The output of customer scoring could be a risk level or an opportunity.

name: CVPS
shortDescription: Customer Profiling
longDescription: The Customer Value Profiling function comprises segmentation based on the customer value and/or lifetime value: Regrouping of the customers in relevant sets (even subsets) for Marketing. The segmentation criteria use the customer value, the customer lifetime value, the product and service uses (consumption behaviours).

name: CVP
shortDescription: Customer Profiling
longDescription:
The Customer Value Profiling function comprises measure and follow up of the customer value: Development of a model in order to determine the customer value from its uses (traffic, products and services used?), and corresponding revenues and costs.
The follow-up of the customer value evolution (identification of the evolution tendencies of the value and actions concerning the creation or destruction of value, Average Revenue Per User,  margin per user).

name: CCCC
shortDescription: Customer/Internal Collaboration/Chat
longDescription: Customer/Internal Collobartion/Chat provides the means for customer to agent or agent to support online chatting.

name: CDA

Customer/Prospect Data Acquisition includes information about the service location, billing address, demographic information about the customer, any existing products and services the customer currently has, as well as the customer's needs (requirements).

name: DSA

longDescription: Data Store Accessing: Interfaces for High performance, high security and high availability to dedicated data management applications.

This includes encryption/decryption and logging according to compliance guidelines.

longDescription: Database of all tests which need to be run against a particular Network Type

longDescription: A dealer's online access function to make them self-sufficient and avoid the need for them to call the call center for Upgrade of customer?s products/services.

name: DMAPC

longDescription: In service design/assign the function selects/assigns appropriate network facility route(s) and configures facility equipment per engineering rules as well as obtains new assets from network plan and build (capacity management) if required.

name: NFR
shortDescription: Fault Reporting & Analytics
longDescription: The Network Fault Reporting function provide the necessary functionality to provide reports about the various faults within the service provider's network, including the archival of these reports.  This can include standard periodic operational reports as part of running the network to special reports requested by Root Cause Analysis.

name: NFS
shortDescription: Planning Design Automation
longDescription: Support forecasting functionality to be applied at different levels of detail and over different time frames. Some types of forecast are more relevant to Strategic and others more relevant to Tactical Planning. Both product volume forecasts and utilization trends are relevant to this automation function

name: NRD
shortDescription: Resource Discovery
longDescription: The resource Discovery functions are responsible for discovering the resources and their details through a management channel. These functions may either directly communicate with the Network resources or communicate through a Resource Domain Manager. The functions should be able to support either retrieving the overall resource information or the detailed resource information which can include sub-components.

name: NV
shortDescription: Planning Design Automation
longDescription: Provides a more generalised view of the network than found in resource management.

name: NPIAM
shortDescription: Product Lifecycle Management
longDescription:
Introduce and maintain new products as part of the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) in appropriate systems e.g. Product Catalogue. For Product Offerings, it permits to define and update :
- commercial name and characteristics of the offer
- subscription and packaging rules
- tariffs specifications
- link with the commercialized products

name: NSIAM
shortDescription: Service Catalog Management
longDescription: Introduce and maintain new services as part of the Service Lifecycle Management (SLM) in appropriate systems e.g. Service Catalogue.

name: NTANRD
longName: New technology and new resource designing
shortDescription: Resource Design / Assign
longDescription: New technology and new resource designs

name: NA&IE
shortDescription: Network Number Inventory Management
longDescription: Manages the Acquisition of numbers and the estabilishment of a number inventory.

name: NA
shortDescription: Network Number Inventory Management
longDescription: Manages the aging of numbers before they can be re-assigned.

name: NA
shortDescription: Network Number Inventory Management
longDescription: Manages the assignment of numbers for usage.

name: NPO
shortDescription: Number Portability Orchestration
longDescription: Number Portability Orchestration communication mechanism that ensures the orders activation according to a criteria set, allowing in this way the correct execution of orders

name: NPPM
shortDescription: Number Portability Policy Management
longDescription: Number Portability Policy Management: Management that regulates policies, standards, definitions and restrictions defined by the entities involved in Number Portability (country-specific regulatory entities).

name: NPR&EM
shortDescription: Number Portability Risk & Effectiveness Management
longDescription: Number Portability Risk & Effectiveness Management for determine of threats, risks and control of fulfillment, in order to comply with the execution of all Number Portability orders.

name: NPV
shortDescription: Number Portability Validation
longDescription: Number Portability Validation can perform calculations that determine whether the information received is reliable, safe and contains the minimum information required during implementation, enabling with this the orders rejection for those who do not comply with the defined criteria.

name: NR
shortDescription: Network Number Inventory Management
longDescription: Provides the functionality to manage the reservation of numbers.

name: NS
shortDescription: Network Number Inventory Management
longDescription: Provides the means to search the number inventory.

name: NTAR
shortDescription: Network Number Inventory Management
longDescription: Provides functionality to track numbers and perform number reporting.

name: OCCM
shortDescription: Off-Line Contact Channel Management
longDescription:
Off-Line Contact Channel Management provides the means to capture and manage activities that cannot or were not completed via an online channel contact. It also provides the means to place an activity on the ?off line? queue that originated from an off-line channel such as email, postal mail, fax, etc.
Note: An activity can be completed on a different channel from which the request originated.

name: OAPC
shortDescription: Customer Order Establishment
longDescription:
The Offer and Product Configuration function enables the configuration of the commercial offer chosen by the customer. 

The configuration recovers the choice of an option, the choice of the functions values ...

It can be based on product configurator using a rule engine.

It can be used at the same time by Selling, Order Establishment or Develop Sales Proposal Business activities.

name: OAPM
shortDescription: Proposal Management
longDescription: Offer Management provides the necessary functionality to provide the customer personalized proposals, taking into account the customer location, needs, current products, as well as the service provider's products, sales emphasis and targets, etc.

name: OTBT
shortDescription: Transportation & Travel Service
longDescription: Online Reservations provided by a robust online booking tool.

name: OCSVT
shortDescription: Customer SLA Violation Management
longDescription: Customer SLA Violation Management function to track and manage open Customer SLA  issues.

name: ODR
shortDescription: Dispute Management
longDescription: When a customer questions a charge, account representatives work with the customer to resolve the disputed charge. Open disputes are entered into the dispute management system where an audit process keeps track of its progress until it?s closed.

name: OSS
shortDescription: Fault Surveillance
longDescription: This Fault Surveillance function is responsible for displaying the operational status of resources in either a tabular or graphical representation or both. The function is responsible for collecting the status messages and correlating them to resource topology.

name: OD
shortDescription: Direct Sales Force
longDescription: Create and dispatch opportunities to relevant employees/sales personnel. Capture customer information and qualify leads according to the guidelines set by your company (cf Customer Information Management). Sales opportunities are dispatched to sales representatives in the field.

name: O&QM
shortDescription: Direct Sales Force
longDescription: Direct Sales Opportunity & Quote Management creates and manages customer accounts, creates quotes, including internal approval, and develop sales opportunities

name: ONDD
shortDescription: Strategic Planning
longDescription: Determine optimum network deployments, such as tier structuring and resilient topologies.

name: OCAN
shortDescription: Virtual Network Operators (Dealers)
longDescription: A Virtual Network Operators online access function to make them self sufficient for Order capture and negotiation. Including the use of VNO/Dealer data fencing.

name: OIS
shortDescription: OSS Inventory/Data Synchronization Management
longDescription: OSS Inventory/Data Synchronization Management represents the function that ensure OSS Inventory data generated in each application is available to other applications as required.

name: ONRF
shortDescription: Customer Recommended Action
longDescription:
For Outbound, it provides necessary hooks to reach out to the customer via preferred channel such as SMS, email or Social media 
For Inbound, Self-Service or Call Center touch points can get recommendation and a guided action flow to complete the suitable customer treatment (ex. Credit Adjustment handled by agent, or bill dispute initiation via self-service)

name: PP(H
shortDescription: Customer Bill Charge Calculation
longDescription: This function handles partial rating period, i.e. prorating.

name: PACAM
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Relationship Management
longDescription: Partner Account Creation and Management

name: PCI
shortDescription: Catalog Management
longDescription:
Partner integration for both export and import of catalog entities
- Export to external partners: A Catalog Management application should include the ability to allow partners (e.g. Content Providers, or other SPs) to browse in catalog in real time or batch mode. Not all data shall be exposed; security and access control (as mentioned above) are essentials features
- Import from external partners: External partners may want to populate catalogs with their own (entities) specifications and be able to create associations with existing entities. Access control, validation and testing must be set appropriately.

name: PIM
shortDescription: Wholesale / Interconnect Billing
longDescription: Accurate, flexible bi-directional invoicing for various settlement periods.

name: PBEP
shortDescription: Wholesale / Interconnect Billing
longDescription: Processing the events generated by the partners? business activities for invoicing and payment purposes.  Including accounting of partners' activities.

name: PIAI
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Assurance Management
longDescription: Receiving and Passing inquires and issues between the service provider and supplier/partner per contractual arrangements.

name: PA
shortDescription: Intellectual Asset Management
longDescription: Administering Patents, Trademarks etc.

name: PI&TC
shortDescription: Intellectual Asset Management
longDescription: Patent, Invention & Trademark Collection support will collect possible patent, invention and trademark candidates

name: PI&TM
shortDescription: Intellectual Asset Management
longDescription:
Patent, Invention & Trademark Collection support will collect possible patent, invention and trademark candidates
Patent, Invention & Trademark Management manages the registration process and making the knowledge available within the enterprise

name: PCT
shortDescription: Collection
longDescription: Pause / Resume collection treatment

name: PG
shortDescription: Payroll Management
longDescription: Generates Paycheck/Paystub deliverable in Paper and/or Electronic form.

name: PIDDPS
longName: Payment Interface Direct debit payment support
shortDescription: Payment Interface Management
longDescription: Supports direct debit payments from the nominated (specified) bank accounts.

name: PIM
shortDescription: Payment Interface Management
longDescription: Manages interfaces between the service provider and payment channel organisations where payment

name: PIRTS
shortDescription: Payment Interface Management
longDescription: Supports refund transactions based on the saved payment transaction details.

name: PFR
shortDescription: General Ledger Account Reconciliation
longDescription: General Ledger Account Reconciliation function for Payroll

name: PR
shortDescription: Payroll Management
longDescription:
Output payroll results to Financial Accounting. 
Generates applicable reporting and analytics.

name: PSC
shortDescription: Payroll Management
longDescription: Calculates Salary for current period.

name: PWC
shortDescription: Payroll Management
longDescription: Calculates Wages based on hourly rate plus any applicable adjustments such as overtime earned.

name: PWADC
shortDescription: Payroll Management
longDescription: Calculates Payroll Taxes and outputs to applicable agencies. Calculates Withholdings such as Federal Income Tax, and calculates deductions such as medical insurance, union dues and charitable contributions.

name: PPE&LC
shortDescription: Resource Logistics
longDescription: People, part, event coordination function to coordinate the availability and deployment of resources to their in-service locations.

name: PMCA
shortDescription: Collection
longDescription: Perform manual collection activities (e.g. make call)

name: PFM
shortDescription: Performance Management & Feedback
longDescription: KPI feedback calculation and presentation, as well as Identification and evaluation of competencies.

name: PGF
shortDescription: Performance Management & Feedback
longDescription: Performance Appraisal relative to (set) Goals and Gap analysis

name: PGS
shortDescription: Performance Management & Feedback
longDescription: Setting of Short and Long Term goals.

name: PM
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Assurance Management
longDescription: Performance Management, including the performance of the supplier/partner or service provider equipment as well as the performance of the actual partner or service provider.

name: PMDA
shortDescription: Resource Performance Monitoring
longDescription: Performance monitoring data accumulation for resource performance monitoring

name: PBWOA
shortDescription: Work Order Assignment & Dispatch
longDescription:
Periodic bulk work order assigning taking into consideration the following criteria: 
o work order priority 
o associated SLAs 
o work order due date 
o required skills to perform work 
o dependencies between work items/orders  
o job location relative to other assignments made to the dispatchable staff 
o workload of staff 
o staff availability hours

name: PCP
shortDescription: Customer Profiling
longDescription: The Personalize Customer Profile function creates a personalized profile signature based on combined segment, interest and behavior for the individual ?customer?  (ex. Soccer Mom, Gold/Silver/Bronze customer, Golfer, Early adopter), and around ?content? (ex. Content sharing - College kids + Field Sales). This also includes continuous learning and update of individual ?Profile Signature?

name: PIIH
shortDescription: Implementation Planning
longDescription: Provide levels of implementation details that tactical planning does not need to specify, such as duct routes and the frame appearances of device ports.

name: PISI
shortDescription: Implementation Planning
longDescription:
Identify Shortfalls in Physical Infrastructure - Identify shortfalls in infrastructure, such as building capacity, which may not be visible to central tactical planning users.
This requires large amounts of data, potentially leading to a very expensive system solution. However, such systems are used locally for construction projects, so the system does not require a live view of the complete network. It is only necessary to administer a physical planning solution centrally to ensure data consistency; the data itself may be distributed to individual locations

name: PLASRD
longName: Physical, logical, and software resources designing
shortDescription: Resource Design / Assign
longDescription: Physical, logical, and software design of resources including definition of configuration variables and initial parameters.

name: PADCS
shortDescription: PKI and Digital Certificates
longDescription: Integration to Public Key Infrastructure Systems that provides digital certificates, and the support to use public keys and digital certificates.

name: PSA
shortDescription: Service Activation Management
longDescription: Planning of service activation to access, plan and gather additional information for service activation

name: POSM
shortDescription: Retail Outlets
longDescription: The Points of Sales Management function manages points of sales data (points of sales organisation , outdoor marketing campaigns?), cash registers? The following functions are out of scope: stock management, replenishment management.

name: PO
shortDescription: Price Optimization
longDescription: Price Optimization enables sales to effectively evaluate the customer, generate recommendations for price decreases and increases, and set negotiation guidelines based on our cost. This includes the application of non-standard pricing.

name: PCA
shortDescription: Privacy Consent
longDescription: A Privacy Dashboard function used to obtain consent from the "Data Subject Party" at the time of a change to the Privacy Profile. This can be initiated by the "Data Subject Party" at creation of new usage, or by the Service when delivering a new scenario.

name: PDPSU
shortDescription: Privacy Data Exposure
longDescription: A Privacy Dashboard function that provides possibility for the Party to alter the Privacy Profile, with authorized values.

name: PDPB
shortDescription: Privacy Data Exposure
longDescription: A Privacy Dashboard function for Privacy Data Browsing used to provide the "Data Subject Party" the ability to view the current privacy profile attributes, of the Privacy Profile, both associated default values of rules defined, and the current values of rules.

name: PR
shortDescription: Virtual Network Operators (Dealers)
longDescription: A Virtual Network Operators online access function to make them self sufficient for Problem resolution. Including the use of VNO/Dealer data fencing.

name: PAPGPR
longName: Process and product group profitability reporting
shortDescription: Financial Business Unit Reporting
longDescription: Financial Business Unit Reporting function for Process cost and product group profitability reporting

name: POMAP
shortDescription: Procurement
longDescription: Requisition and order monitoring including Ensuring supplier payment

name: PR&OM
shortDescription: Procurement
longDescription: Manage the requisitions for material and placing the orders with the contracted supplier/partner

name: PROOSI
longName: Produce reports on open SLA issues
shortDescription: Customer SLA Reporting
longDescription: Customer SLA Reporting function provide the necessary functionality to report open SLA issues

name: PAAC
shortDescription: Offering Availability
longDescription: Check  products  availability in the customer area

name: PCT
shortDescription: Product Performance Management
longDescription: Tracking of performance of a products based upon their performance in the marketplace with regards to campaigns.

name: PCA
shortDescription: Product Performance Management
longDescription: Product capacity analysis from a Product Performance perspective.

name: PCB
shortDescription: Channel Guidance and Data Capture
longDescription: Product catalog browsing ? identify products available for purchase by a given customer, provide relevant information (e.g. cost, requirements, configurable attributes) to the customer. This information will be used in the step guidance.

name: PCB
shortDescription: CSR fulfillment
longDescription: Product catalog browsing ? identify products available for purchase by a given customer, provide relevant information (e.g. cost, requirements, configurable attributes) to the customer. This information will be used in the step guidance.

name: PC
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Product Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Product certification/decertification to be an integrated part of the service provider's value proposition.

name: PCM
shortDescription: Product Performance Management
longDescription: Product Cost Management  from a Product Performance perspective.

name: PCR
shortDescription: Product Performance Management
longDescription: Product cost reporting  from a Product Performance perspective.

name: PCAM
shortDescription: Product Catalog Management
longDescription: See: Cross Domain- Catalog Management for detailed function de-composition

name: PMF
shortDescription: Product Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Model products as part of the design and build phase of the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)

name: POUAD
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Product Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Product onboarding, updating, and decommissioning

name: PRASF
shortDescription: Product Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Solicit and Define product requirements and provide detailed specifications as part of the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)

name: PR
shortDescription: Product Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Function for Obsolesce/retire product offering as part of the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)

name: PRR
shortDescription: Product Performance Management
longDescription: Product revenue reporting  from a Product Performance perspective.

name: PSL
shortDescription: Product Strategy / Proposition Management
longDescription: Link strategy to propositions and Link propositions to products

name: PSPR
shortDescription: Product Strategy / Proposition Management
longDescription: Strategy Performance Reporting - Enable performance reporting of the strategy, driven by the performance of the underlying products

name: PSPM
shortDescription: Product Strategy / Proposition Management
longDescription: Strategy Delivery Project Management - Project manage the delivery of strategy through propositions through products

name: PAAC
shortDescription: Project Accounting
longDescription: Project Accounting Asset Capitalization where the costs to acquire the asset are expensed over the life of that asset rather than in the period it was incurred.

name: PABC
shortDescription: Project Accounting
longDescription: Project Accounting Budget Creation at any level in multiple currencies to provide the required functionality to create financial reports specifically designed to track the financial progress of projects, which can then be used by managers to aid project management.

name: PABC
shortDescription: Project Accounting
longDescription: Project Accounting Budgetary Controls to check available project funds with hard or soft controls

name: PAC
shortDescription: Project Accounting
longDescription: Project Accounting Comparison of budget, actual, commitment, and revenue amounts

name: PACD
shortDescription: Project Accounting
longDescription: Project Accounting Cost Distribution using auto-allocation rules

name: PAR
shortDescription:
Financial Core Operations Reporting
Project Accounting
longDescription: Project Accounting Status Reporting to provide the required functionality to track the financial progress of projects, which can then be used by managers to aid project management.

name: PATC
shortDescription: Project Accounting
longDescription: Project Accounting Transaction Controls based on expenditure category, expenditure type, employee, or non-labor resource

name: PEP
shortDescription: Project Accounting
longDescription: Project Expenditure Posting to projects' Project Accounting providing the required functionality to create financial reports specifically designed to track the financial progress of projects, which can then be used by managers to aid project management.

name: PF
shortDescription: Project Management
longDescription: Project Management Tool project resource, time and budget utilization follow.

name: PP
shortDescription: Project Management
longDescription: Project Management Tool for project resource, time and budget planning

name: PR
shortDescription: Project Management
longDescription: Project Management Tool for reporting of project progress and follow up results.

name: PFPM
shortDescription: Space Planning
longDescription: Space Planning offers a visual way to format, update and report property space information.

name: PLM
shortDescription: Real Estate Property & Building Portfolio and Lease Management
longDescription: Lease Management plans, tracks, manage and maintain all aspects of leased real estates.

name: PTCAF
shortDescription: Corporate Tax
longDescription: Corporate Tax function to calculate and submit tax filings for Fixed Asset Tax for all service provider companies and affiliates.

name: PUM
shortDescription: Space Planning
longDescription: Space Planning Utilization Management for benchmarking, space efficiency and quickly identifying vacant and underutilized space, used for planning and space optimization.

name: PO
shortDescription: Product Strategy / Proposition Management
longDescription: Support the Organization of the propositions by operations (e.g., which operating groups are delivering which propositions and where are the crossovers)

name: POCC
shortDescription: Charge Calculation
longDescription: Proration of calculated charges/credits.

name: QAPCP
shortDescription: Customer Problem Qualification & Reception
longDescription:
Problem validation and prioritization doing: 
o Qualify Symptoms/Reason for call (when reception is via a customer contact).  Non-qualified issues will be referred appropriately.  
o Associate received problem with appropriate customer(s)  and customer products/services (when reception is via a southbound or northbound system)

name: QAC
shortDescription: Service Quality Analysis
longDescription: Support function to provide conclusions to relevant areas to make improvement proposals

name: QDSE
shortDescription: Service Quality Model Establishment
longDescription: Definition and establishment of data sources for monitoring of input from customer contracts or service definitions.

name: QIE
shortDescription: Service Quality Model Establishment
longDescription: Establishment of KQIs and SLOs and the rules and policies connected to them.

name: QBS
shortDescription: Bill Inquiry
longDescription: Query of Billing related Balances including un-billed balance

name: RAA
shortDescription: RA Analysis
longDescription: RA Analysis function provide necessary functionality to diagnose deteckted revenue assurance related problems.

name: RCC
shortDescription: RA Control and Configuration
longDescription: RA Control & Configuration function establishes the policies and rules to be applied to the Revenue Assurance process.  It includes baselining acceptable limits and values from which actions will be taken.

name: RCM
shortDescription: RA Control and Configuration
longDescription: RA Control & Configuration Assurance function assures that the RA process is executingaccording to specified rules and controls.

name: RCI
shortDescription: RA Correction & Recovery Initiation
longDescription: RA Correction Initiation provides the necessary functionality to initiate correction of the revenue assurance anomalies. Given that Revenue Assurance will detect issues originating in ordering, provisioning, billing, and usage, it is likely the correction or recovery will also need to be performed in those domains.

name: RMAD
shortDescription: RA Monitoring
longDescription: RA Monitoring function analyze processes (both interprocess and intraprocess) for RA anomalies, and looks for situations that are outside of the established baselines and triggers alerts when those situations are detected for further analysis. RA Monitoring looks for both "immediate" anomalies as well as predicts anomalies via trend analysis

name: RMDC
shortDescription: RA Monitoring
longDescription: RA Monitoring function provide the necessary functionality to collect data from product, service, and resource (network) layers within fulfillment, assurance, and billing, as well as information from supplier/partner transactions.

name: RPM
shortDescription: RA Tracking & Management
longDescription: RA Tracking & Management function provides necessary functionality to assure that Revenue Assurance problems are assigned, coordinated, and corrected efficiently, escalating as needed per established business rules.

name: RPRV
shortDescription: RA Tracking & Management
longDescription: RA Tracking & Management function provides necessary functionality to assure that Revenue Assurance problems resolution is verified.

name: RPT
shortDescription: RA Tracking & Management
longDescription: RA Tracking function provides necessary functionality to assure that Revenue Assurance problems are tracked from inception to resolution.

name: RRI
shortDescription: RA Correction & Recovery Initiation
longDescription: RA Recovery Initiation provides the necessary functionality to initiate recovery of the lost revenue.

name: RR
shortDescription: RA Reporting
longDescription: RA Reporting provides the functionality to report on the status of Revenue Assurance activities, including the status of issues currently being monitored, analyzed, and remedied.  RA Reporting also reports on data derived from the fulfillment, assurance, and billing data collected for monitoring.

name: RP
shortDescription: Implementation Planning
longDescription: Provides Radio Planning for cell site coverage and quality and for cell-to-cell coverage is a specialist function used in Implementation Planning.

name: RPASS
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: customer self empowered Rate plans amendment function provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake an amendment of existing Rate plans (Products).

name: RCPT
shortDescription: Campaign Performance Tracking
longDescription: Campaign Performance Tracking in Real-time in customizable segmentation schemes and key metrics.

name: REACB
shortDescription: Real Estate Asset Capital Planning
longDescription: Real Estate Asset Capital Budgeting supports the process of budgeting Real Estate Assets for the future long term plans.

name: RECM
shortDescription: Real Estate Capital Construction Management
longDescription: Support for Real estate project management emphasizing the construction process, and the documents involved for each construction phase.

name: REFM
shortDescription: Real Estate Facility Operations Management
longDescription:
Real Estate Facility Management prioritize the day-to-day operations to increase the user/occupier's workplace needs and demands.
Real Estate Facility Management function supports the Facility Managers control of the expenses and operational planning.

name: REHPPAFS
longName: Real Estate HSE Policies/Objectives Planning and Followup Support
shortDescription: Environmental Health & Safety Monitoring and Compliance Management
longDescription: Real Estate HSE Policies/Objectives Planning and Followup Support can be used by enterprises with a high profile of environment and personnel care to set policies and objectives for continuous improvement.

name: REHRAAS
longName: Real Estate HSE Regulation and Auditing Support
shortDescription: Environmental Health & Safety Monitoring and Compliance Management
longDescription:
Real Estate HSE Regulation and Auditing Support supports the investment and operational organizations to be aware of the applicable laws and industry standards. In addition it supports the possibility for HSE auditing. 
HSE (Healty, Safety & Environmental) aspects of real estates, and equipment and services related to the real estates needs to be evaluated continuously to comply to applicable laws and relevant industry standards.

name: REMALA
longName: Real Estate Market and Location Analysis
shortDescription: Real Estate Asset Capital Planning
longDescription: Analysis and market planning to find the best markets and the best locations within those markets for investment or leasing.

name: REPM
shortDescription: Real Estate Property & Building Portfolio and Lease Management
longDescription: Real estate property management prioritize to increase the building?s Net Operating Income and value. The Real estate property management functions support the Property management.

name: RC
shortDescription: Customer Bill Charge Calculation
longDescription: This function recalculates the charges when appropriate across product, location, or customer, and considerations based on business rules.

name: Recalculation
shortDescription: Charge Calculation
longDescription: recalculation of charges/credits based on information received later (e.g. from the Service Level Agreement function, delayed call detail record file arrival, delayed order arrival). Recalculation may be necessary: pre-billing (prior to Bill Calculation), during the Bill Calculation process, and/or post-billing.

name: RACA
shortDescription: Virtual Network Operators (Dealers)
longDescription: A Virtual Network Operators online access function to make them self sufficient for Receivables and Collection activities. Including the use of VNO/Dealer data fencing.

name: RP
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Assurance Management
longDescription: Receiving problems from the partner that require service provider assistance in resolving.

name: ROPFC
shortDescription: Customer Problem Qualification & Reception
longDescription: Reception of problems from Customers, Southbound internal systems (service problem management, service performance management, service quality management) or Outside northbound systems, including social networks/third parties.

name: RAFI
shortDescription: Customer Recommended Action
longDescription: Integration with existing business function/service and process (ex. Offer, Knowledge Management)

name: RACLF
shortDescription: Customer Recommended Action
longDescription: Closed loop functionality to learn from whether the recommended action was accepted or not, including functionality to avoid proactive backfire (i.e. ensuring a customer reach out action doesn?t result in confusion and more calls to the call center)

name: R&ETAPI
longName: Reconciliation & Escheatment to Accounts Payable Integration
shortDescription: Cash Reconciliation & Escheatment
longDescription: Cash Reconciliation & Escheatment function for Integration with Accounts Payable applications

name: RRM
shortDescription: Records Retention Management
longDescription:
Record Retention Management of data and information monitor and assures compliance with the retention aspects of federal and state laws,
legal requirements and expectations as well as the enterprise policies and procedures.

name: ROUFS
shortDescription: Cash Reconciliation & Escheatment
longDescription: Cash Reconciliation & Escheatment function for Recovery of unclaimed funds payable to the service provider that may be held by various jurisdictions

name: RAIPI
shortDescription: Bill Inquiry
longDescription: List all invoice items for a specific invoice

name: RASR
shortDescription: Recruitment & Staffing
longDescription:
Recruitment and Staffing Reporting provides the following functionality:
? Legal and Regulatory reporting 
? Analytics such as attrition rate

name: RDCAM
shortDescription: Wholesale / Interconnect Billing
longDescription: Product and Service Definition - Definition of products and services, pricing schemes, partner entities and contracts into the system. Easy uploading of reference data from external sources such as XML files.

name: ROPAS
shortDescription: Affiliates
longDescription: Registration function for pre-activated services/products. Preparing for mass pre-activation and sub-sequent affiliate sales.

name: R&CDM
shortDescription: Regulatory & Compliance Management
longDescription: Regulatory & Compliance Documentation Management Function of compliance documentation of the laws, regulations and internal policies.

name: R&CM
shortDescription: Regulatory & Compliance Management
longDescription: Regulatory & Compliance Monitoring Function includes monitoring of pertinent laws, regulations and internal policies.

name: R&CR
shortDescription: Regulatory & Compliance Management
longDescription: Regulatory & Compliance Reporting of proof of compliance to to the pertinent laws, regulations and internal policies.

name: RDA
shortDescription: Payment Validation & Authorization
longDescription: Provides remittance details to the bill accounts receivable management application within the service provider billing system.

name: RCAS
shortDescription: Cash Reconciliation & Escheatment
longDescription: Cash Reconciliation & Escheatment  function for Replacement check approval.

name: RORTR
shortDescription: Resource Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Reporting of resource end to end test results back to the client

name: ROSTR
shortDescription: Service Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Reporting of service end to end test results back to the client

name: RIH
shortDescription: Location Management
longDescription: Provides ability to maintain data integrity in the whole location repository. It?s especially important if there are many external data sources that deliver new addresses for the repository.

name: RTDC
shortDescription: Dispute Management
longDescription: An agreed-upon dispute adjustment is resolved after approval.

name: RCPS
shortDescription: Customer Problem Diagnostics
longDescription:
Support Problem resolution with the following data to resolve the customer problem: 
o Customer Topology and inventory type data (e.g., logical and physical inventory) 
o Customer Information including the business organizational hierarchy 
o Change Management data 
o Customer Service Order data

name: RANAIU
longName: Resource Activation Notification and Inventory Update
shortDescription: Resource Activation
longDescription: Resource Activation Notification and Inventory Update functions including: ? Notify Resource Provision / Control of the activation status ? Update Resource Inventory with the resource status information

name: RAO
shortDescription: Resource Activation
longDescription: Resource Activation Orchestration Functions including: ? Queued / scheduled activation requests ? Configuration validation and rollback ? Manage dependencies within, and across network elements through rules  ? Multiple NE activation coordination

name: RA
shortDescription: Resource Activation
longDescription: Resource Activation Functions including: ? Update the resource instance to perform the activation or deactivation ? Multi-vendor and multi-technology activation ? Update the resource to activate Billing data collection ? Confirm / identify available resources

name: RAC
shortDescription: Assign/Procure Network Resources
longDescription: Determines facility and equipment availability needed for service designing/assigning. It checks appropriate network facility route(s) according to engineering rules.

name: RAV
shortDescription: Resource Availability
longDescription:
The Resource Availability function validates that the resource or resources specified on the resource order are available at the specified customer/service location and feasible from a network point of view. This includes the following:
? Resource address validation 
? Resource availability validation 
? Resource feasibility validation 
? Establishment of service termination points 
? Determination of delivery interval

name: RCSM
shortDescription: Capability Specification Management
longDescription: This function involves the creation, editing, storage and retrieval of capability specifications. The capability specifications represent the general, common and invariant characteristics of resource that may be realized in more than one type of specific resource. Examples of capability are Layer2, Data, radio and Transport.

name: RCPM
shortDescription: Resource Change Management
longDescription: Function for resource change project management including 1: Support project management of build projects. 2: Coordinate project activities with the suppliers. 3: Provides the orchestration between planning duties and to manual network engineering activities. 4: Provide jeopardy management, 5: Engineering management (Work Orders, Parts and Event coordination)

name: RCTFCC
longName: Resource Change to Financial Control Collaboration
shortDescription: Resource Change Management
longDescription: Supports interface to financial control in order to authorize the expenditure - Supports interface to financial control in order to authorize the expenditure required to purchase the required resources.

name: RCWC
shortDescription: Resource Change Management
longDescription: 1: Interfaces to Workforce Management 2: Support collaborative project management across business boundaries. 3: Supports links to vendors ERP- via B2B portals and to internal network engineering duties for in-station and street activities

name: RC
shortDescription: Resource Commissioning & Configuration Management
longDescription: Resource commissioning process - Manage the commissioning process of a resource and ensuring that operational status' are configured

name: RCAO
shortDescription: Resource Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Resource Configuration and Onboarding: When a resource is added (on boarded), this onboarding may be automated. There are several systems in the infrastructure that needs to be aware and integrated with the new resource. The ?Resource Configuration and Onboarding? function will configure the on boarded Resources and the relevant systems to establish integration automatically, when requested.

name: RCL
shortDescription: Resource Commissioning & Configuration Management
longDescription: Resource Configuration Logs - Record the history of configuration changes

name: RCM
shortDescription: Resource Commissioning & Configuration Management
longDescription: Resource Configuration Management - Configuration Database and management of the configurations of the individual resources

name: RCPC
shortDescription: Resource Order Configuration Management
longDescription: Compose a resource configuration plan according to the required resource actions and sent to Resource Order Orchestration and/or Network Resource Activation

name: RCV
shortDescription: Resource Commissioning & Configuration Management
longDescription: Resource Configuration Verification in Design, Work with other applications to ensure that the resource configuration matches the designed configuration

name: RDG
shortDescription: Resource Order Data Collection
longDescription: Resource Order Data Collection function gather any needed resource data to aid in the verification and issuance of a complete and valid resource order.

name: RDPRT
shortDescription: Resource Fault & Performance Data Mediation
longDescription: Tools to set up and maintain resource data parsing rules

name: RDP
shortDescription: Resource Fault & Performance Data Mediation
longDescription: Resource Data Mediation represents the functions that enable the OSS and the networked resource to exchange data and command and control by parsing of data from one format to another

name: RDPR
shortDescription: Resource Fault & Performance Data Mediation
longDescription: Resource fault and performance data pattern recognition

name: RDATA
shortDescription: Strategic Planning
longDescription: Analyze demand forecasts and utilization trends for the network architecture and capacity, together with the strategy for the deployment of network and IT technology within the architecture. It predominately supports processes in Strategy, Infrastructure and Product wing of the Business Process Framework.

name: RDWA
shortDescription: Resource Design / Assign
longDescription: Resource design function for "What-if configurations and modeling"

name: RETETCSUATD
longName: Resource end to end test configuration setting up and tearing down
shortDescription: Resource Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Setting up and tearing down the end to end test configuration for resource testing

name: RETETE
longName: Resource end to end test execution
shortDescription: Resource Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Test execution of the end to end resource testing

name: RETETRI
longName: Resource end to end test results interpretation
shortDescription: Resource Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Resource end to end test results interpretation

name: RETETS
longName: Resource end to end test scheduling
shortDescription: Resource Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Scheduling of end to end testing of resources

name: RIMC
shortDescription: Resource Inventory Management
longDescription: Resource Information Model creation function allows Service Providers to create information base in the resource inventory of the managed resources along its attributes. This function uses the standardized information model (e.g. TM Forum Information Framework) for the resources to be managed. The specific details will depend on the particular resources (e.g., particular types of managed elements and equipments) and associated technologies.

name: RIALMS
longName: Resource Instantiation and Lifecycle management support
shortDescription: Resource Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Resource Instantiation and Lifecycle management support: Resource performance and availability may be controlled by managing multiple instances of the Resource allocated to one or more applications. The ?Resource Instantiation and Lifecycle management support? function will control the starting of new instances and closing of instances of a Resource like but not limited to CPU, Memory etc.

name: RIR
shortDescription: Resource Inventory Management
longDescription: This function entails a reconciling function for the inventory with inventory discovered from another source (typically, the network). When new inventory information is discovered, this is tried to be matched with an entity or entities already known and updated accordingly and if there is no match then new information is created. It can work periodically or on demand in real-time.

name: RIR
shortDescription: Resource Inventory Management
longDescription:
This function allows for client operations support (service assurance and billing systems) to retrieve part or all of the resource inventory known to the target OSS. 
This feature may allow the following selection criteria:
? retrieval of a specified set of one or more sub-trees
? exclusion or inclusion of specified object types from the selected sub-tree 
? further filtering based on attribute matching 
? retrieval of only the object instances that have been modified after a provided date and time 
? For the selected objects, this feature may allow the client operations support (service assurance and billing systems) to specify what specific attributes and relationships shall be returned. This (the attributes and relationships to be returned) would be the same for all objects of the same type.

name: RIUN
shortDescription: Resource Inventory Management
longDescription:
This function entails the generation of inventory update notifications based on changes to the inventory;  Notifications concerning object creation, object deletion and attribute value changes to other systems. 
? Single Entity Notifications ? in this variation of the feature, each notification pertains to only one entity, e.g., an equipment instance 
? Multi-entity Notifications ? in this variation of the feature, a single notification may report on inventory changes for multiple entities. 
? Notification Suppression ? in this variation of the feature, each notification pertains to only one entity.

name: RIU
shortDescription: Resource Inventory Management
longDescription: This function entails requesting that another inventory (referred to as the target OSS) update the inventory based on a provided collection of updates. The expectation is that the target inventory is updated as requested, but no other side-effects are expected (e.g., creating an Sub Network Connection (SNC) in the network). This is a key point concerning this capability. The inventory update request can involve addition (new object), modification (change to an existing object) or deletion (removal of an object).

name: RIU
shortDescription: Resource Order Configuration Management
longDescription: Update information in the resource inventory as to configuration of specific resources

name: RL
shortDescription: Resource Logistics
longDescription: Resource logistics function coordinate the availability and deployment of resources to their in-service locations. Resource logistics functions identify and distribute resource stock where needed as quickly as possible.

name: RNI
shortDescription: Resource Logistics
longDescription: Resource needs logistics identification function supporting supply chain management applications to identify resource needs and order placement

name: ROKD
shortDescription: Resource Logistics
longDescription: Resource or kit distribution function to coordinate the availability and deployment of resources to their in-service locations.

name: ROC
