shortDescription: Resource Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Completes the resource order when all activities have been completed

name: ROCM
shortDescription: Resource Order Configuration Management
longDescription: The Resource Order Configuration Management function is similar to the service design/ assign functions outlined elsewhere in this publication. The service is built up of services and the services are built of resources. For a full compound Service configuration there is a need for Resource configuration for the Resource Order to support aggregate customer facing services. Services can be viewed as being comprised of a number of building blocks - e.g. bandwidth, security, maintenance packages, SLAs, QoS, specific features e.g. voicemail. Service Configuration management might be either the set up of network / resource components for a customer, or a class of customers of a generic service build. Service configuration can be derived from order details in addition to inherent business rules from service specifications.

name: RODM
shortDescription: Resource Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Manages dependencies across resource orders by triggering and follow up as needed

name: ROJT
shortDescription: Resource Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Raises jeopardies as appropriate if specified dates and workflow milestones are not met, and escalates jeopardies to appropriate management levels

name: ROM
shortDescription: Resource Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: This function provides workflow and orchestration capability for the Resource order fulfillment.

name: ROV
shortDescription: Resource Service Order Validation
longDescription: The Resource Order Validation function validates the resource order request based on contract, catalog, and provisioning rules.

name: ROI
shortDescription: Resource Order Publication
longDescription:
The Resource Order Publication function issues valid and complete resource orders, and stores the order into an appropriate data store.
As part of order publication, additional data might be obtained or derived to support downstream functions that are not provided in the resource order request.

name: ROT
shortDescription: Resource Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Tracks the various resource orders until completed

name: RPR
shortDescription: Resource Order Configuration Management
longDescription: Reserve the right resource parameters based on resource specification and resource inventory.

name: RPA
shortDescription: Resource Order Configuration Management
longDescription: Allocating the right resource parameters to fulfill resource orders

name: RPDAAT
longName: Resource Performance Data aggregation and trending
shortDescription: Resource Performance Monitoring
longDescription: Data aggregation and trending in resource performance monitoring

name: RPDA
shortDescription: Resource Performance Analysis
longDescription:
Service Performance Analysis functions provide the necessary functionality to analyze the performance of the various service provider's services.  This includes:
? Analyzing performance data received from Service Performance Monitoring and historic performance data or system environment data
? Notify operations applications for automatic or manual action in case of alarming analysis results.
? Determining the root causes of service performance degradations 
? Provide recommendations for performance improvements and trend analysis

name: RPDC
shortDescription: Resource Performance Monitoring
longDescription: Performance data collection, including real time monitoring data.

name: RPECAF
longName: Resource Performance event correlation and filtering
shortDescription: Resource Performance Monitoring
longDescription: Performance event correlation and filtering in resource performance monitoring

name: RPR
shortDescription: Resource Performance Reporting
longDescription: Resource Performance Reporting provides the functionality required to generate reports about the performance of the service provider's resources.

name: RPM
shortDescription: Resource Logistics
longDescription: Resource problem management (fault management) resource logistics function to identify and distribute resource stock where needed as quickly as possible.

name: RSCM
shortDescription: Resource Logistics
longDescription: Resource Supply Chain Management function identify vendors and alternate sources, and manage order fulfillment

name: RTID
shortDescription: Resource Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Resource Task Item Decomposition: By a request for an orchestration of a resource the Task Item needs to be analyzed and decomposed into the part-actions necessary to take to fulfill the requested resource orchestration. The resource task item may consist of several resource tasks and may use a number of Resources. It may also be controlled by several parameters for optional behaviors. This composition of the Resource is given by configuration data available from Catalog applications and the Resource Capability Orchestration application.

name: RTIPCC
longName: Resource Task Item Policy Control Configuration
shortDescription: Resource Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Define and configure the policies which will be implemented during the Resource task item lifecycle.

name: RTISCTC
longName: Resource Task Item Sequence Carry Through configuration
shortDescription: Resource Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Resource Task Item Sequence Carry Through configuration: The ?Resource Task Item Sequence Carry Through? function controls so that the sequence is fulfilled, or rolled back. The rules for the sequence execution will set the conditions for the fulfillment, or roll-back, and for the reporting and notification. The ?Resource Task Item Sequence Carry Through configuration? is a management of the application function that defines how the execution of the orchestration sequence will be done.

name: RTISCT
longName: Resource Task Item Sequence Carry Through
shortDescription: Resource Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Resource Task Item Sequence Carry Through: Because of the ?Resource Task Item Decomposition? of an orchestration request the result may be several actions that needs to take place in a specific sequence. The ?Resource Task Item Sequence Carry Through? function executes each individual item in sequence to fulfill, or roll back according to a pre-defined configuration, and reports the sequence carry through result.

name: RTISCC
longName: Resource Task Item Sequence Control Configuration
shortDescription: Resource Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Resource Task Item Sequence Control Configuration: Each task item (action) in a Resource Task Item Sequence will perform according to a pre-configured configuration. The ?Resource Task Item Sequence Control Configuration? is a management of the application function that defines that the execution of each resource task item (action) will be done as part of an orchestration.

name: RTISC
shortDescription: Resource Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Resource Task Item Sequence Control: Because of the ?Resource Task Item Decomposition? of an orchestration request the result may be several actions that need to take place in a specific sequence. Each action is an item in the ?Resource Task Item Sequence? and will perform according to a pre-configured configuration. The ?Resource Task Item Sequence Control? controls the execution of each Item?s action.

name: RTRAAM
longName: Resource test resources acquisition and management
shortDescription: Resource Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Acquisition and management of end to end test resources including test head availability

name: RTRIPM
longName: Resource Test result interpretation policy management
shortDescription: Resource Test Strategy and Policy Management
longDescription:
Resource Test Strategy and Policy Management interpretation of test results functions provide the necessary functionality to manage how the test results should be interpreted.
Strategies can range from simple (e.g. - check the status of a router) to complex (e.g. - perform an end-to-end test on a circuit and sectionalize the problem).

name: RTRD
shortDescription: Resource Test Strategy and Policy Management
longDescription:
Resource Test Strategy and Policy Management test rules defining functions provide the necessary functionality to manage the local rules that define the strategies for conducting a test.
Strategies can range from simple (e.g. - check the status of a router) to complex (e.g. - perform an end-to-end test on a circuit and sectionalize the problem).

name: RTV
shortDescription: Resource Commissioning & Configuration Management
longDescription: Resource Topology Verification in Inventory Mgmt. Systems - Work with the Inventory Management applications to ensure that the topology reflected in its database is in sync with that in the Inventory Management Systems

name: RCT
shortDescription: Collection
longDescription: Pause / Resume collection treatment

name: RI
shortDescription: Retail Outlets
longDescription: Specific to retail stores, order management should be capable of supporting contract printing, integration with a locally installed cash management/cash register and a retail inventory system for order completion.

name: ROB
shortDescription: Retail Outlets
longDescription: Retail Outlet Billing management function provides access to Billing management specific to retail stores.

name: ROCARM
longName: Retail Outlet Contact and retention management
shortDescription:
Retail Outlets
Virtual Network Operators (Dealers)
longDescription: Customer contact and retention management capabilities

name: ROCIM
shortDescription: Retail Outlets
longDescription: Retail Outlet customer information portal function provides access to Complete customer information management capabilities.

name: ROOCAN
longName: Retail Outlet Order capture and negotiation
shortDescription: Retail Outlets
longDescription: Retail Outlet Order capture portal function provides access to Order capture and negotiation capabilities

name: ROPR
shortDescription: Retail Outlets
longDescription: Problem resolution specific to retail stores, problem resolution should be capable of handling handset repairs, including reverse logistics and advance exchange

name: ROARID
longName: Retrieval of appropriate resource inventory data
shortDescription: Resource Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Retrieval of appropriate inventory data for resource end to end testing

name: ROASID
longName: Retrieval of appropriate service inventory data
shortDescription: Service Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Retrieval of appropriate inventory data for service end to end testing

name: ROO
shortDescription: Customer Order Orchestration
longDescription: Submission of a retro-active order with a past effective date (e.g. retroactive price plan change) and the handling of manual intervention requests (for order fallouts).

name: RER
shortDescription: Financial Core Operations Reporting
longDescription: Financial Core Operations Reporting function for Intercompany Revenue Eliminations Reporting

name: RACBMP
longName: Roll-over and cyclic Balance Management policies.
shortDescription: Balance Management
longDescription: Record definition of policies per balance or balance type of roll-over and cyclic policies

name: RCA
shortDescription: Fault Correlation & Root Cause Analysis
longDescription: Root Cause Analysis function includes the ability to isolate the root cause based on the correlation analysis, fault isolation and problem identification with the help of supporting integrated systems for rule based testing as well as integration with trouble ticketing sysems.

name: SAAR
shortDescription: Salary Planning
longDescription:
Salary Analytics and Reporting provides the following functionality:
? Reporting and Analytics

name: SP
shortDescription: Salary Planning
longDescription:
Salary Planning provides the following functionality:
? Compensation Comparison (internal/external) 
? Salary Grades and Ranges 
? Job Descriptions 
? Merit Increases 

? Application of Compensation 
? Salary Updates 

? Reporting and Analytics

name: SUA
shortDescription: Salary Planning
longDescription:
Salary Update Administration provides the following functionality:
? Application of Compensation 
? Salary Updates

name: S&MR
shortDescription: Sales & Marketing Reporting
longDescription: Sales & Marketing Reporting provides insight into multiple aspects of Sales & Marketing, including closed loop marketing, sales metrics, forecasting, sales workflow, funnel and pipeline activities.

name: S&UTCAF
longName: Sales & Use Tax  calculation and filings
shortDescription: Corporate Tax
longDescription: Corporate Tax function to calculate and submit tax filings for Sales & Use Tax for all service provider companies and affiliates.

name: SAA
shortDescription: Sales Account Assignment
longDescription: Sales Account Assignment provides the necessary functionality to assign customers to a service provider?s sellers (either third party or internal). Ownership might further be differentiated based on various products with the same customer. Sales Account Assignment also maintains the sales hierarchy (different than HR reporting hierarchy) for sales compensation, sales forecasting, and sales results.

name: SAP
shortDescription: Sales Account Planning
longDescription: Sales Account Planning looks at the service provider?s complete relationship with a large customer. This includes the customer?s outages, revenues, opportunities in the pipeline, etc. It allows the account executive to effectively manage the service provider?s relationship with the customer and to plan the selling strategy going forward.

name: SFA
shortDescription:
Direct Sales Force
Sales & Marketing Reporting
longDescription: Forecast Analysis: This function should enable data analysis of your sales pipeline and predict the revenue that will result when opportunities are won and deals are finalized. Forecasts are either Sales forecasts, which one can apply to anticipate the consumer demand or Order forecasts, which enables CSP?s to determine whether the supply required is available to meet expected consumption levels.

name: SJAW
shortDescription: Sales Job Aids
longDescription: The Job Aids function to access active aids like template or wizard types of context-aware scripting to e.g. aid lead qualification as an example.

name: SJQRG
shortDescription: Sales Job Aids
longDescription: The Job Aids function to assist in performing various sales related tasks while conforming to organizational standards of the passive type, such as in the case of a searchable price book.

name: SLC
shortDescription: Lead Generation & Management
longDescription: Lead Generation handles the generation of leads. A lead can be generated from many different sources and customer interactions including the result of a targeted marketing campaign. Potential customer information is obtained from external sources or from internally generated data.

name: SMF
shortDescription: Sales & Marketing Reporting
longDescription: Sales Metrics calculation according to pre-defined metrics rules

name: SN
shortDescription: Sales Negotiation
longDescription:
Sales Negotiation provides support for negotiating the sale by providing multiple quotations as needed, taking into account the customer data, customer qualification, and offers made. Functionality includes access to products, product pricing, scheduling of appointments if a dispatch is necessary, etc.
Sales Negotiation generates an order or service request.

Customer order request generation ? send solution design details to update proposal product order in Customer Order Management systems 

Service order request generation ? send solution design details to update service order in Service Order Management systems (after customer agreement ? part of handoff to fulfillment)

name: SOR
shortDescription: Sales & Marketing Reporting
longDescription: Sales Order Reporting provides reporting of order handoffs.

name: SPS
shortDescription:
Sales Job Aids
Sales Product Support
longDescription: Sales Product Support function gives access to appropriate product information on the various products being sold by the service provider. This can include information such as product descriptions, configuration constraints, eligibility rules, and possibly pricing information.

name: SSATCCA
longName: Self service Access to Call center agents
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Access to Call center agents Customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to undertake a variety of fulfillment functions directly for themselves.

name: SSACFAU
longName: Self service Account creation for anonymous user
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Account creation for anonymous user Customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to create an account

name: SSBV
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. Bill view

name: SSBO
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Bulk Ordering corporate customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to undertake a bulk ordering.

name: SSCAFCOU
longName: Self Service Calls assignment for classification of usage
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. Calls assignment for classification of usage

name: SSCA
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Check availability customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to undertake a check product availability.

name: SSCC
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Check compatibility customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to check product compatibility.

name: SSCE
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Check eligibility customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to undertake an eligibility check for products.

name: SSCSPC
longName: Self Service customer SLA preferences capture
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Customer SLA preferences capture customer self empowered fulfillment function.

name: SSDCAR
longName: Self Service Dispute capture and resolution
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. Dispute capture and resolution access to the Dispute Management

name: SSIPC
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to undertake Installation preferences capture.

name: SSKMA
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Self Service access to Knowledge Management database & solutions to common problems

name: SSOSE
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Order status customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to undertake Order status enquiry.

name: SSP
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. Payment capture

name: SSPV
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. Penaties View

name: SSPCAOB
longName: Self Service Product catalogue and Offerings browsing
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Product Catalog and offerings browsing  customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to undertake selected Product Catalog Browsing.

name: SSQPI
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Quote prize  customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface for the customer to get Quotation price

name: SSROFASA
longName: Self Service Reports on fulfillment and SLA aspects
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Self service access to Reports on fulfillment and SLA aspects.

name: SSROUAC
longName: Self Service Reports on usage and charges
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. web based reports for (historical) usage and charges.

name: SSSCDOM
longName: Self Service Shopping cart driven order management
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Fulfillment
longDescription: Shopping cart driven order management  customer self empowered fulfillment function provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake self service purchase.

name: SSSS
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. Split statement for demarcation between calls

name: SSUCV
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. Unbilled charges view

name: SSUACC
longName: Self Service Usage and charges comparison
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. Usage and charges comparison

name: SSUV
shortDescription: Customer Self Empowered Billing
longDescription: Customer self empowered billing functions provide an internet technology driven interface to the customer to undertake a variety of billing functions directly for themselves. E.g. Usage view including address book driven usage view

name: SRMN
shortDescription: Service-Resource Inventory
longDescription: Notification of Service-Resource Relationship Management actions to relevant stakeholders

name: SRM
shortDescription: Service-Resource Inventory
longDescription: Service-Resource Relationship Creation, Update and Deletion of the relations of stand-alone physical or logical resources whose assignment is critical to service's  fulfilment, and whose tracking is critical to service operations, assurance, and billing, as well as, resources, which represent a larger resource structure supporting the service, often referred to as an Access Point.

name: SRR/S
shortDescription:
Service-Resource Inventory
Service Inventory Reconciliation / Synchronization
longDescription: The Service-Resource Relationship Reconciliation / Synchronization function entails reconciliation of the data in a Service Inventory Management system with inventory discovered from another source and/or synchronization of mismatched service inventory records.

name: SAV
shortDescription:
Service Address Validation
Service Availability Validation
longDescription: Service address validation function validates that the service or services specified on the service order are feasible from a network point of view.

name: SACC
shortDescription: Service Assurance Control
longDescription: Service Assurance Control Calculation calculates corrective actions to prevent or restore performance and quality. The calculations are rule based and takes the service?s dynamics into account to perform a closed loop control to hold the performance and quality at a decided level.

name: SADM
shortDescription: Service Assurance Control
longDescription: Service Assurance Deviation Monitoring analyzes the monitoring information to identify deviations from set values for performance and quality indicators. Service availability deviations are also detected.

name: SATM
shortDescription: Service Assurance Control
longDescription: Service Assurance Trouble Mitigation have autonomic rules to minimize the lack of service by doing mitigation action e.g. restart or re-routing etc. to mitigate the negative impact for the customer from a service problem or fall-out.

name: SAV
shortDescription:
Service Address Validation
Service Availability Validation
longDescription: Service availability validation function validates that the service or services specified on the service order are available at the specified customer/service location.

name: SCA
shortDescription: Service Activation Management
longDescription: Implements and activates the specific service configuration against the service configuration plan (including activation of CPE if part of the service offering)

name: SC
shortDescription: Service Configuration Management
longDescription: Configuring the specific service and it?s parameters as appropriate for the fulfilment of a service order

name: SDAAT
shortDescription: Service Performance Monitoring
longDescription: Aggregation and trending of collected Service Performance Data

name: SDC
shortDescription: Service Data Collection
longDescription: The Service Data Collection function gathers any needed service data to aid in the verification and issuance of a complete and valid service order as well as data necessary to address dependencies between service and/or resource orders.

name: SDM
shortDescription: Design Solution
longDescription:
The Design Solution function supports the end to end service design. It applies engineering rules to determine required network facilities, equipment configurations and the method and access path to the customer site or location of service termination. 
This function also establishes and manages the detailed design tasks required to issue the work orders.

name: SETETCSAT
longName: Service end to end test configuration Setting and Tearing
shortDescription: Service Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Setting up and tearing down the end to end test configuration for service testing

name: SETETE
longName: Service end to end test execution
shortDescription: Service Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Test execution of the end to end servcie testing

name: SETETRI
longName: Service end to end test results interpretation
shortDescription: Service Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Service end to end test results interpretation

name: SETETS
longName: Service end to end test scheduling
shortDescription: Service Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription: Scheduling of end to end testing of services

name: SFC
shortDescription: Offering Availability
longDescription:
Based on the customer service location, service feasibility checks are 
done to assure the offering can actually be provided to the customer. This 
implies that the customer location is clearly established. Service feasibility 
checks are conducted via contract with the Service Order Management 
application.

name: SIALMS
longName: Service Instantiation and Lifecycle management support
shortDescription: Service Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Service Instantiation and Lifecycle management support: Software based Services? performance and availability may be controlled by managing multiple instances of the service. The ?Service Instantiation and Lifecycle management support? function will control the starting of new instances and closing of instances of a service.

name: SLPR
shortDescription: Customer SLA Reporting
longDescription: Customer SLA Reporting function provide the necessary functionality to report the service providers performance per specified service level

name: SOC
shortDescription: Service Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Completes the service order when all resource orders have been completed.

name: SOD
shortDescription: Product/Service Order Decomposition
longDescription:
The Service Order Decomposition function decomposes the service orders, into sub-sequent service orders and resource order requests, and then distributes each request to perform the work.  
This function also translates planned design changes into implementation jobs (which could include service ordering and/or delivery) that may span multiple resource facing services and technology domains.  This might require additional data gathered via Service Data Collection. 
 
Note:  If an order repository or common order data services (common model) layer is being used and shared across layers (Customer, Service, and Resource layers), this decomposition can simplified

name: SOE
shortDescription: Service Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Provides status on the overall service order.

name: SOO
shortDescription: Service Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Sequences resource order provisioning if required.

name: SOT
shortDescription: Service Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Tracks the various resource orders until completed.

name: SOTS
shortDescription: Service Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Oversees the transfer of Service Order Requests to appropriate resource providers.

name: SOV
shortDescription: Service Order Validation
longDescription: The Service Order Validation function validates the service order request based on contract, catalog, and provisioning rules.

name: SPA
shortDescription: Service Configuration Management
longDescription: Allocating the right service parameters to fulfill service orders

name: SPR
shortDescription: Service Configuration Management
longDescription: Reserve the right service parameters based on service specification and service inventory for a service order

name: SPDA
shortDescription: Service Performance Analysis
longDescription:
Service Performance Analysis functions provide the necessary functionality to analyze the performance of the various service provider's services.  This includes:
? Analyzing performance data received from Service Performance Monitoring
? Notify operations applications for automatic or manual action in case of alarming analysis results.
? Provide recommendations for performance improvements and trend analysis

name: SPDC
shortDescription: Service Performance Monitoring
longDescription: Collection of Resource Performance Data from the Resource Management Applications (or directly in the absence of Resource Performance Management application) and Collection of Service Performance data through end-to-end tests done internally through the application or external Service Test applications. Including archiving.

name: SPECAF
longName: Service performance event correlation and filtering
shortDescription: Service Performance Monitoring
longDescription: Service performance event correlation and filtering, mapping the performance data to service topology and identifying service related performance problems

name: SPM
shortDescription: Service Performance Monitoring
longDescription: Monitoring of Service performance data including notification and accumulation for e.g. Service Performance Dashboard.

name: SPR
shortDescription: Service Performance Reporting
longDescription:
Service Performance Reporting provides the necessary functionality required to generate reports about the performance of the service provider's services. 
These reports may be generated as part of the normal periodic operations ("scheduled"), or may be as a result of a specific analysis request ("in-demand").  Report types include near real time, historical view, and trend analysis.
Relevant performance reports are also provided to service/network planning to perform network updates.

name: SPRCA
shortDescription: Service Performance Analysis
longDescription: Support for analyzing performance data received from Service Performance Monitoring, considering service topology to support determining the root causes of service performance degradations

name: SPCV
shortDescription: Service Problem Analysis
longDescription: Support function for Verification that service configuration matches the product features

name: SPC&R
shortDescription: Service Problem Correction & Resolution
longDescription:
Service Problem Correction & Resolution functions provide the necessary maintenance functionality to resolve the service problem back to a normal operational state as efficiently as possible, and automated notification to applications responsible for automatic problem mitigation on the services and resources.
This may involve automated or manual restoration activities.  It may also reconfiguration, re-assignments, temporary work-arounds, and/or dispatches of field technicians.

name: SPCR
shortDescription: Service Problem Correction & Resolution
longDescription: Service Problem Correction Reporting and notification of correction status to applications and personnel responsible for problem mitigation of the services and resources.

name: SPMC
shortDescription: Service Problem Monitoring
longDescription: The function is responsible for collecting the status messages and correlating them to service topology and comparing them to the established Service monitoring model.

name: SPMMDD
longName: Service Problem Monitoring Model Data Definition
shortDescription: Service Problem Model Establishment
longDescription: Accepting input from customer contracts, service definitions (KQIs, SLOs etc.) or changes in the service topology which needs to established for monitoring of services wrt to problems.

name: SPMMDI
longName: Service Problem Monitoring Model Data Integration
shortDescription: Service Problem Model Establishment
longDescription: Establishment of data sources for monitoring of the above.

name: SPMMD
shortDescription: Service Problem Model Establishment
longDescription: Definition of the service problem monitoring model and its dependencies

name: SPMME
shortDescription: Service Problem Model Establishment
longDescription: Establishment of model to derive, identify and mitigate Service Problem.

name: SPMR
shortDescription: Service Problem Monitoring
longDescription: Service Problem Monitoring Reporting function is responsible for displaying and notifying the operational status of services to operations personnel and applications.

name: SPP
shortDescription: Service Problem Analysis
longDescription: Prioritization of currently open service problems, giving consideration to problem impact, service level agreement, etc. The function will send notifications to operations applications for manual or automatic mitigation or correction.

name: SPR
shortDescription: Service Problem Reception
longDescription: Service Problem Reception functions provide appropriate functionality to receive customer problems (manually or automated) that are perceived to be service affecting as well as resource troubles (faults).

name: SPR
shortDescription: Service Problem Reporting
longDescription: Service Problem Reporting functions provide the necessary functionality to report on the status of open service problems.  This includes operational reports, management reports, reports against various metrics, as well as information needed by other BSS or OSSes.

name: SPSM
shortDescription: Service Problem Monitoring
longDescription: Service Problem SLA Monitoring function is comparing the service problem status' and availability against established service level agreements.

name: SPTA
shortDescription: Service Problem Analysis
longDescription: Analysis function for analysis of service problem test results

name: SPTI
shortDescription: Service Problem Analysis
longDescription: Issuing service tests, including one time tests or a series of tests over a period of time. Notify the test results to operations personnel and applications.

name: SPT&M
shortDescription: Service Problem Tracking & Management
longDescription: Service Problem Tracking & Management functions provides necessary functionality to assure that service problems are assigned, coordinated, and restored efficiently, escalating as needed.

name: SQA
shortDescription: Service Quality Analysis
longDescription: Service Quality Analysis functions analyze and evaluate the quality data collected by Service Quality Monitoring, and considering the past service quality data or system environment data in the analysis, notifying operations applications for automatic or manual action in case of alarming analysis results.

name: SQC&M
shortDescription: Service Quality Collection & Monitoring
longDescription: Service Quality Collection & Monitoring collects service quality related information from established sources, including service performance management, service problem management, third parties, and customers. Collected data is logged for further analysis and monitored for direct notification in case of significant quality deviation.

name: SQC
shortDescription: Service Quality Analysis
longDescription: Comparison of the collected service quality data to the KQIs and SLOs established by SQM Establishment.

name: SQC
shortDescription: Service Quality Analysis
longDescription: Service quality information correlation from various sources to determine root cause and impact

name: SQMD
shortDescription: Service Quality Model Establishment
longDescription: Definition of the service quality model and its dependencies

name: SQR
shortDescription: Service Quality Reporting
longDescription: Service Quality Reporting functions generate various reports on service quality and makes them available for consumption. E.g. Visual aids

name: SQT
shortDescription: Service Quality Analysis
longDescription: Service quality evaluation of the trends over time

name: SRPA
shortDescription: Service Problem Analysis
longDescription: Analysis of customer's present and past problem information by correlation and consolidation of the various customer problems and resource troubles intoa single root service problem

name: STICAO
longName: Service Task Item Configuration and Onboarding
shortDescription: Service Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Service Task Item Configuration and Onboarding: When a software based service is added (on boarded), this onboarding may be automated. There are several systems in the infrastructure that needs to be aware and integrated with the new service. The ?Service Configuration and Onboarding? function will configure the on boarded service and the relevant systems to establish integration automatically, when requested.

name: STID
shortDescription: Service Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Service Task Item Decomposition: By a request for an orchestration of a service the service needs to be analyzed and decomposed into the part-actions necessary to take to fulfill the requested orchestration. The Service may consist of several services and may use a number of Resources. It may also be controlled by several parameters for optional behaviors. This composition of the Service is given by configuration data available from Catalog applications and the Service Capability Orchestration application.

name: STIPCC
longName: Service Task Item Policy Control Configuration
shortDescription: Service Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Define and configure the policies which will be implemented during the Service task item lifecycle.

name: STISCTC
longName: Service Task Item Sequence Carry Through Configuration
shortDescription: Service Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Service Task Item Sequence Carry Through Configuration: The ?Service Task Item Sequence Carry Through? function controls so that the sequence is fulfilled, or rolled back. The rules for the sequence execution will set the conditions for the fulfillment, or roll-back, and for the reporting and notification. The ?Service Task Item Sequence Carry Through configuration? is a management of the application function that defines how the execution of the orchestration sequence will be done.

name: STISCT
longName: Service Task Item Sequence Carry Through
shortDescription: Service Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Service Task Item Sequence Carry Through: Because of the ?Service Decomposition? of an orchestration request the result may be several actions that needs to take place in a specific sequence. The ?Service Task Item Sequence Carry Through? function executes each individual item in sequence to fulfill, or roll back according to a pre-defined configuration, and reports the sequence carry through result.

name: STISCC
longName: Service Task Item Sequence Control Configuration
shortDescription: Service Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Service Task Item Sequence Control Configuration: Each item (action) in a Service Task Item Sequence will perform according to a pre-configured configuration. The ?Service Task Item Sequence Control Configuration? is a management of the application function that defines that the execution of each service task item (action) will be done as part of an orchestration.

name: STISC
shortDescription: Service Capability Orchestration
longDescription: Service Task Item Sequence Control: Because of the ?Service Task Item Decomposition? of an orchestration request the result may be several actions that need to take place in a specific sequence. Each action is an item in the ?Service Task Item Sequence? and will perform according to a pre-configured configuration. The ?Service Task Item Sequence Control? controls the execution of each Item?s action.

name: STPD
shortDescription: Service Termination Points Determination
longDescription: The Service Termination Points Determination function determines the appropriate service provider entry point to support the Customer's service request.

name: STRAAM
longName: Service test resources acquisition and management
shortDescription: Service Test Lifecycle Management
longDescription:
Acquisition and management of end to end test resources including test head availability
Acquisition and management of test resources

name: STRIPM
longName: Service Test result interpretation policies management
shortDescription: Service Test Strategy and Policy Management
longDescription:
Service Test Strategy and Policy Management interpretation of test results functions provide the necessary functionality to manage how the test results should be interpreted.
Strategies can range from simple (e.g. - check the status of a router) to complex (e.g. - perform an end-to-end test on a circuit and sectionalize the problem).

name: SM
shortDescription: Wholesale / Interconnect Billing
longDescription: Oversee the Partners? accounting activities. Supported by monitoring tools.

name: SAC
shortDescription: Billing Account Associations Management
longDescription: Link a charge record to shared allowance if exists

name: SSAC
shortDescription: Application Security
longDescription: Single Sign-On Access control integrated with a central Authentication and Authorization functions secures the most updated security.

name: SVN
shortDescription: Customer SLA Violation Management
longDescription: Customer SLA Violation Management function provide the necessary functionality to notify appropriate people or systems to remedy the SLA violation.

name: SUP
shortDescription: Vulnerability Management
longDescription: Software Update Planning for applying in a timely manner the software patches and upgrades that address known vulnerabilities

name: SDE
shortDescription: Solution Design
longDescription:
The Solution Design Editor function combine/configure the emerged solution based on the existing solution, planned changes and newly designed features (e.g. for site connectivity services)
Selecting relevant Products and Services from Catalog ? Browse and select entries from a catalog that might be relevant to the set of captured requirements into the design.

name: SD
shortDescription: Solution Pricing
longDescription: Solution Discounting function supports that Rules and guidelines are provided as to standard levels of discounts/promotions  that can be provided to the customer. Special discount arrangements can be obtained by following an escalation process. There is workflow functionality to help manage discount escalation.

name: SP
shortDescription: Solution Pricing
longDescription: The Solution  Pricing function is concerned with assuring that the designs are priced consistent with pricing used for billing. The common product catalog provides an initial price base for the components that are in the solution vs. the existing configuration at the customer location.

name: SRC
shortDescription: Solution Requirements Capture
longDescription:
Solution Requirements Capture, ? Capture the overall solution requirements (e.g. target date, customer locations, multi-location/shared services)
and ? Capture the particular requirements for each customer location as part of the desired solution

name: SVM
shortDescription: Solution Design
longDescription:
Solution Variations management ? Enable the creation of multiple solutions either from scratch or based on a cloned solution select desired variation.
Selecting relevant Products and Services from Catalog ? Browse and select entries from a catalog that might be relevant to the set of captured requirements into the design.

name: SCA
shortDescription: Auditing
longDescription: Auditing function for SOX compliance

name: SIRS
shortDescription: Spares & Warehouse Inventory Management
longDescription: Support retrieval, update, update notifications and reconciliation for the Spares & Warehouse Inventory Management

name: SI
shortDescription: Spares & Warehouse Inventory Management
longDescription: Database of all spares including location of the spares, as part of the Spares & Warehouse Inventory Management

name: SBD
shortDescription: Customer Bill Charge Calculation
longDescription: Performing charge and event distribution to support a split bill

name: SCBMB
shortDescription: Balance Management
longDescription: Split charges between multiple balances.

name: SR
shortDescription: Recruitment & Staffing
longDescription:
Staff Recruiting provides the following functionality:
? Job Descriptions/Job Briefs 
? Sourcing of candidates through job boards, job fairs, advertisements, referrals, company job site

name: Staffing
shortDescription: Recruitment & Staffing
longDescription:
Staffing provides the following functionality:
? Tracking of candidate through process. 
? Interviewing candidates by recruiter. 
? Ranking of candidates for hiring manager interview. 
? Background checks.
? Organizational Management

name: SR
shortDescription: Resource Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Provides status on the resource order

name: SBOD
shortDescription: Resource Logistics
longDescription: Stock balancing or distribution in reaction to special events or disasters

name: SCT
shortDescription: Collection
longDescription: Force account into collection / Stop collection treatment

name: SMM
shortDescription: Logistics Management
longDescription:
Logistics Management functionality for Put-away of materials to targeted storage locations and Picking of materials to fulfill orders 
including Staging and assembly of materials as required

name: SNSDS
shortDescription: Strategic Planning
longDescription: Support Strategic Network Sizing Decisions -Support strategic decisions as to which locations and which links to grow or shrink across the network

name: SPRI
shortDescription: Strategic Planning
longDescription: The strategic planning result can be inventoried in either strategic or tactical planning system, but data will need to exist in both to support interworking.

name: SSD
shortDescription: Strategic Planning
longDescription: Determine which locations are to become strategic sites.

name: SCAM
shortDescription: Product Strategy / Proposition Management
longDescription: Capture and manage details of the strategy and resulting propositions

name: SMR
shortDescription: Logistics Management
longDescription: Logistics Management functionality for Receipt of materials from suppliers

name: SAEM
shortDescription: Wholesale / Interconnect Billing
longDescription: Automatic and manual handling of records found in error, mass correction and re-rating of events.

name: SB&SDM
shortDescription: Wholesale / Interconnect Billing
longDescription: Management of inter-carrier billing and settlement disputes and other supplier/partner services including content and e-commerce disputes.

name: SIR
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Invoice Reconciliation
longDescription: Supplier/Partner Invoice Reconciliation uses the charges (and e.g. adjustments) from the supplier/partner along with substantiating information available to the service provider to reconcile the invoice presented by the supplier/partner.

name: SOH
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Order Management
longDescription: Track, monitor and report on a service provider initiated order to ensure that the interactions are in  accordance with the agreed commercial arrangements between the service provider and another party.

name: SPH
shortDescription: Wholesale / Interconnect Billing
longDescription: Handling of payments in the area of of Supplier/Partner billing and settlement. Logging and tracking of full or partial payments.

name: SR
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Reporting
longDescription: Supplier/Partner Reporting provides information as appropriate concerning orders, trouble tickets, campaign and sales results, product usage, billing data, inquiries on products, product feedback, as well as lead and opportunity data.  This information can be made available to relevant service provider or partner staff and systems.

name: SRM
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Order Management
longDescription:
The Supplier / Partner Requisition Management function manages the purchase requests and approvals and convert purchase approvals into standard purchase orders.
It also manages requisitions for Network infrastructure maintenance and investment,  only used for purchase of Network infrastructure. 
Ex: Technical partner needs to purchase material for a planned or emergency infrastructure work. It may then be booked as an investment or maintenance expenditure.

name: SSPOC
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Portal
longDescription: Supplier/Partner Portals provides a single entry point for suppliers and partners to access various tools used for ordering, assurance, reporting, product management and reconciliation

name: STMT
shortDescription: Wholesale / Interconnect Billing
longDescription: Monitoring tools for monitoring of automated billing, settlement and payment to ease and expedite dispute management.

name: SWM
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Workflow
longDescription: Supplier/Partner Workflow Management function provide workflow and orchestration for supplier/partner management activities.

name: SR
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Data Collection
longDescription: Partner Settlements reporting provides the necessary functionality to create reports that substantiate the settlement.

name: Supplier/PartnerSettlements
shortDescription: Supplier/Partner Data Collection
longDescription: Partner Settlements provides the necessary functionality to calculate a settlement with the partner, initiate the payment or bill to the partner.

name: SCOAST
longName: Supply Chain Order and shipment Tracking
shortDescription: Supply Chain Order Tracking Management
longDescription: Supply Chain Order and Shipment Tracking provides the necessary functionality to track the movement of shipments from point of origin through cross-docks, and to the final destination.

name: SDP
shortDescription: Supply Chain Planning
longDescription: Demand planning and forecasting, including coordinating the demand forecast of all marketing plans and requisitions, and sharing the forecast with all suppliers

name: SSP
shortDescription: Supply Chain Planning
longDescription: Sourcing planning, including current inventory and forecast demand, in collaboration with all suppliers

name: SFMSS
shortDescription: Balance Management
longDescription: Support for multiple simultaneous sessions that affect a common balance.

name: SLARM
shortDescription: Customer Experience Monitoring
longDescription:
The Support Loyalty and Retention function undertakes trend analysis on loyalty and retention, including customer acquisitions and churn.
It comprises:
? Follow-up of the churn rate: Development of a report in order to measure by period (periodicity: weekly, monthly, yearly?),
? The number and rate of terminations by product & service,
? The trend of the churn rate according to the previous periods.
? Prediction of the churn (anticipate in order to minimise the attrition): identification of the potential churner profiles from a predictive model analysing the churner profiles according to the previous periods.

name: SPS
shortDescription: Operations Portal
longDescription: The Operations Support Portal encompasses Portal Infrastructure for internal / center use into which functional components are plugged. The Framework provides the ?foundation? for the development of agent-facing functionality.

name: SPTS
shortDescription: Center Efficiency Tools
longDescription:
Center Efficiency Tools provides various non-portlet enabled scripts and tools for the agent to automate specific tasks.
This function can also include terminal and system emulators (Citrix, Attachmate, etc).

name: SSA
longDescription: Support statistical analysis on test results to track the long term error trajectory of a particular resource.

name: TRP
shortDescription: Tactical Planning
longDescription: Tactical Planning; detailed design of resource against the existing networked resource at all technology layers, ensuring that the designed resource is actually deployed and for accurately recording the resultant inventory.

name: TWICT
shortDescription: Orchestration Management
longDescription: Task Work Item Carry Through: Task Work Items will be of different nature and need different actions to be carried through. The ?Orchestration Manager? needs to have functions to carry through a good variety of work items.

name: TWIDC
shortDescription: Orchestration Management
longDescription: Task Work Item Decomposition Configuration

name: TWID
shortDescription: Orchestration Management
longDescription: Task Work Item Decomposition: The Orchestration Manager will know the necessary steps   (workflow items) to be carried through.

name: TWII
shortDescription: Orchestration Management
longDescription: Task Work Item Instantiation, lifecycle management.

name: TWIPCC
longName: Task Work Item Policy Control Configuration
shortDescription: Orchestration Management
longDescription: Define and configure the policies which will be implemented during the task work item lifecycle

name: TWISCTC
longName: Task Work Item Sequence Carry Through configuration
shortDescription: Orchestration Management
longDescription: Task Work Item Sequence Carry Through configuration.

name: TWISCT
longName: Task Work Item Sequence Carry Through
shortDescription: Orchestration Management
longDescription: Task Work Item Sequence Carry Through: To carry through the overall task the items of the task need to be   performed in a specific order. This application function will perform the workflow according   to configuration.

name: TWISCC
longName: Task Work Item Sequence Control Configuration
shortDescription: Orchestration Management
longDescription: Task Work Item Sequence Control Configuration

name: TWISC
shortDescription: Orchestration Management
longDescription: Task Work Item Sequence Control: To carry through the overall task the items of   the task need to be performed in a specific order. This application function will supervise the Task Work Item Carry Through and report and take correcting actions if not performed according to configuration

name: TIR
shortDescription: Financial Reporting
longDescription: Financial Reporting of tax information to Corporate Tax in support of tax compliance.

name: TCT
shortDescription: Telesales
longDescription: Telesales tools for multimedia integration  as Computer Telecom Integration, Predictive dialer, Email, including follow up and cross selling tools.

name: TCAOT
shortDescription: Telesales
longDescription:
Telesales access function to Holistic Customer Information View, including full customer details, recent interactions, pending activities, history , as well as access to 
Complete order capture, negotiation and activation capabilities and Order tracking capabilities

name: TSM
shortDescription: Telesales
longDescription: The Commercial Scripts Management function concerns the management of scripts to make the commercial dialog easier between Customer Service Representative (CSR) and customers (or prospects). They can be used either to make qualification or sales as well as polls. It includes the commercial script production and execution.

name: TAAC
shortDescription: Service Test Command and Control
longDescription: The Service Test Command and Control function provides the necessary functionality to access, command and control the various service test devices required to perform service testing.

name: TSM
shortDescription: Service Test Strategy and Policy Management
longDescription: Service Test Strategy and Policy Management functions provide the necessary functionality to manage the local rules that define the strategies for conducting a test as well as how the test results should be interpreted.

name: T&AR
shortDescription: Time Reporting & Attendance Management
longDescription:
Time & Attendance Reporting provides the following functionality: 
? Attendance and Absence reporting and analytics.

name: TAM
shortDescription: Time Reporting & Attendance Management
longDescription:
Time Attendance Management provides the following functionality:
? Time capture. 
? Time tracking. 
? Time calculations. 
? Time allocation. 
? Attendance and Absence tracking.

name: TCOOT
shortDescription: Fixed Assets
longDescription: Fixed Asset Total Cost of Ownership tracking

name: TDD
shortDescription: Document Delivery
longDescription: Make transactional documents available via paper, CD-ROM, DVD, EDI, electronic, etc, as specified by the customer.

name: TDIF
shortDescription: Transactional Document Generator
longDescription: Formats document information in the customer selected or default format

name: TDIBRTT
longName: transactional Document Input Binding Rules to Template
shortDescription: Transactional Document Formatter
longDescription: Define the binding rules between the input data and the template format

name: TDIDSD
longName: Transactional Document Input Data Source Definition
shortDescription: Transactional Document Formatter
longDescription: Define the data input source specification for run time production

name: TDLF
shortDescription: Transactional Document Generator
longDescription: Formats section legends (summary, call detail, etc) based on regulatory requirements.

name: TDMII
shortDescription: Transactional Document Generator
longDescription: Incorporates marketing messages in the documents

name: TDMASG
longName: Transactional Document Multiple account statement generation
shortDescription: Transactional Document Generator
longDescription: Aggregates multiple accounts, and generates an appropriate invoice/billing statement (if a billing statement).

name: TDRRA
shortDescription: Transactional Document Generator
longDescription: Displays tax id numbers and other legally mandated information in accordance with region specific requirements

name: TDSF
shortDescription: Transactional Document Generator
longDescription: Sends data to downstream interfaces, such as finance, warehouse, etc.

name: TDTRD
shortDescription: Transactional Document Formatter
longDescription: Define and maintain resources (font, colors, images and language) for the template

name: TDTUBR
longName: Transactional Document Template Usage Business Rules
shortDescription: Transactional Document Formatter
longDescription: Develop and maintain business rules for the template usage

name: TAFC
shortDescription: Data Transformation and Formatting
longDescription: Transformation and Formatting Configuration: Transformation and Formatting Configuration function that sets up the possible transformation and formatting algorithms to be used.

name: TM
shortDescription:
Transportation & Travel Service
Transportation Management
longDescription: Transportation Management function that provide workflow and orchestration for the planning of materials to be shipped to and from different locations.

name: UENR
shortDescription: Employee Identification Management
longDescription: Unique Employee Number Registration in a central repository based on secure methods for identity verification. (The repository can be a distributed system.)

name: URC
shortDescription: Balance Management
longDescription: Handling of Unit reservation from a balance for a specified interval (session). Unused units are credited back into the balance when the session is released.

name: USI
shortDescription: Service Configuration Management
longDescription: Update information in the service inventory according to the configuration of specific services

name: USBAI
shortDescription: Billing Account Configuration Management
longDescription: Update specific billing account information such as customer bill periods, bill media options, etc.

name: UEC
shortDescription: Usage Event Processing
longDescription: Usage Event Collection . These functions are required to support both file and event based (batch and real-time) processing when distributed to upstream systems. The events are used in the functions for charging/billing, assurance and management of customers and networks.

name: UEC
shortDescription: Usage Event Processing
longDescription: Usage Event Correlation . These functions are required to support both file and event based (batch and real-time) processing when distributed to upstream systems. The events are used in the functions for charging/billing, assurance and management of customers and networks.

name: UED
shortDescription: Usage Event Processing
longDescription: Usage Event Distribution functions are required to support both file and event based (batch and real-time) processing when distributed to upstream systems. The events are used in the functions for charging/billing, assurance and management of customers and networks.

name: UEE
shortDescription: Usage Event Processing
longDescription: Usage Event Enrichment . These functions are required to support both file and event based (batch and real-time) processing when distributed to upstream systems. The events are used in the functions for charging/billing, assurance and management of customers and networks.

name: UEEC
shortDescription: Usage Event Error Management
longDescription: Categorize unbilled usage events for usage records which have been identified as being non-processable due to edit, rate, guide, routing, etc. Failures

name: UEECI
shortDescription: Usage Event Error Management
longDescription: Provide features to identify the error cause for usage records which have been identified as being non-processable due to edit, rate, guide, routing, etc. failures

name: UEECC
shortDescription: Usage Event Error Management
longDescription: Provide correction capabilities (via mechanized script or manual correction) for usage records which have been identified as being non-processable due to edit, rate, guide, routing, etc. Failures

name: UEG
shortDescription: Usage Event Processing
longDescription: Usage Event Guidance . These functions are required to support both file and event based (batch and real-time) processing when distributed to upstream systems. The events are used in the functions for charging/billing, assurance and management of customers and networks.

name: UEM
shortDescription: Usage Event Processing
longDescription: Usage Event Mediation . These functions are required to support both file and event based (batch and real-time) processing when distributed to upstream systems. The events are used in the functions for charging/billing, assurance and management of customers and networks.

name: VCSAE
shortDescription: Customer Problem Qualification & Reception
longDescription:
This refers to service validation to see what service(s) the customer has subscribed to;, and what service/support to which they are entitled. Such as: 
? Products purchased and being used by the customer 
? Material purchase from the service provider, even if they do not have an account with the said service provider.

name: VDCS
shortDescription: Dealers
longDescription: A dealer's online access function to make them self-sufficient to view dealer commission statements

name: VEBI
shortDescription: Bill Inquiry
longDescription: Invoking a transactional document generation function

name: VUI
shortDescription: Bill Inquiry
longDescription: List all unbilled invoice items for current bill cycle

name: VUSAD
shortDescription: Bill Inquiry
longDescription: View usage summary and details (billed and non-billed) for a specific time period

name: VNDF
shortDescription: Virtual Network Operators (Dealers)
longDescription: A security function that will allow the VNO agents or Dealers to view only their own customers. In some cases, the network provider will use the same BSS environment to serve several VNOs (multi tenancy)

name: VP
shortDescription: Virtual Network Operators (Dealers)
longDescription: VNO Personalization - in cases where the network provider serves multiple VNOs under the same BSS environment (multi tenancy) the user interface of each VNO needs to be ?personalized? to the VNO business (look and feel, business flow, etc.)

name: VCCR
shortDescription: Voice Channel Contact
longDescription: Contact Skills Management profices the required functionality to capture the list of skills required for the contacts that might come in.  These skills are then associated with the service provider agents, as well as to contacts.

name: VCC
shortDescription: Voice Channel Contact
longDescription: Voice Channel Contact function provides the means for a customer to speak to a service representative, including the mechanism to query the customer (e.g. ? IVR) on the nature of their request, and routing of the contact to the best available agent and presentation to the agent of select call information.

name: VD
shortDescription: Voucher Management
longDescription: Voucher Distribution to dealers including shipment and validation of reception of actual vouchers

name: VLCM
shortDescription: Voucher Management
longDescription: Voucher Life Cycle Management including activation, locking, expiration and maintenance of purchased vouchers

name: VO
shortDescription: Voucher Management
longDescription: Voucher Ordering including the ability to generate, modify, authorize and associate a PIN with serial numbers and dispatch the order to the manufacturer

name: VR
shortDescription: Voucher Management
longDescription: Voucher Reporting function for querying and reporting of related data

name: VAP
shortDescription: Vulnerability Management
longDescription: Vulnerability Assessment Planning function for Assessing networks and systems for vulnerabilities and taking proactive action to reduce the vulnerabilities or limit the impacts if they are exploited.

name: WSLP
shortDescription: Resource Logistics
longDescription: Warehouse stock level projections coordinate the availability and deployment of resources to their in-service locations while seeking to minimize stocking levels

name: WAWOC
shortDescription: Work Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Function for coordinating work between dependent or related work orders for Resource dispatchable staff.

name: WOAD
shortDescription: Work Order Assignment & Dispatch
longDescription: Dispatching of work order assignments to dispatchable staff.

name: WOEF
shortDescription: Work Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Escalating function for issues as required when a due date is in jeopardy

name: WOIT
shortDescription: Work Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Establishing and managing information transfer between the operator's workforce management system(s) and those of external third parties (when the infrastructure is owned and operated by third parties)

name: WOMAD
shortDescription: Work Order Analysis
longDescription: Determine required manual activities function provide the necessary functionality to analyze the work order and determine what manual activities are necessary.

name: WOR
shortDescription: Work Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Initiating re-assignments as needed based on changing priorities, technician progress on other job assignments, etc.

name: WOSM
shortDescription: Work Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Managing the transition of the order through its various states.

name: WOSM
shortDescription: Work Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Monitoring the status and progress of the various manual activities, including the various states of the work order

name: WOU
shortDescription: Work Order Tracking & Management
longDescription: Managing updates to orders, including in-flight changes and cancelations

name: WJM
shortDescription: Jeopardy Management
longDescription: This is a function that should be found in any process or workflow management system and warns when a delay in the due date of a task or process step will prevent subsequent tasks from starting, or affect the overall end date of the process.

name: WASC
shortDescription: Workforce Configuration and Setup
longDescription: Configuration of the workforce appointment schedule.

name: WDM
shortDescription: Workforce Configuration and Setup
longDescription: Management of the dispatchable technicians, including skill sets.

name: WF
shortDescription: Workforce Configuration and Setup
longDescription: Forecasting the workload and respective assignable staffing requirements on a daily, weekly, and longer period basis.

name: WMR
shortDescription: Workforce Management Reporting
longDescription: Workforce Management Reporting functions provide the necessary functionality to report on the status of open work orders as well as technician information such as availability, utilization, and overall performance.

name: WM
shortDescription: Resource Logistics
longDescription: Workforce management (preventative maintenance, change management) function coordinate the availability and deployment of workforce resources to their in-service locations.

name: WMAC
shortDescription: Workforce Configuration and Setup
longDescription: Classification ofdifferent types of manual activities provide the necessary functionality to appropriately classify the working activity types and related information.

name: WS
shortDescription: Workforce Schedule Management
longDescription: Workforce Schedule Management function provide the necessary functionality to manage the work schedule, appointment schedule and resource schedule of the dispatchable workforce.

name: WSAM
shortDescription: Workforce Configuration and Setup
longDescription: Management of staff availability, including vacation time.

name: WTTM
shortDescription: Workforce Configuration and Setup
longDescription: Management of technician training and/or coordination and interface with HR systems regarding the training.

name: BIA
shortDescription: The Business Interaction ABE represents an arrangement, contract, or communication between an enterprise and one or more other entities such as individuals and organizations (or parts of organizations). Interactions take on the form of requests, responses, and notifications.

name: IR
shortDescription: A Request for information.

name: IR
shortDescription: A reply to a InquiryRequest.
